jobDescription: Summary At Apple, extraordinary ideas have a way of quickly becoming extraordinary products, services and customer experiences. Sound is an essential and compelling facet of the customer experience. Apple has assembled an elite Acoustics team that enables our customers to experience music with delight, communicate with clarity, and enjoy elegant sound throughout our product line. In Apple Acoustics we work with the utmost attention to detail, directly impacting the design of products that millions of people around the world love! Our Noise & Vibration team contributes to hardware design, validation, and troubleshooting to minimize distracting audible noises and vibrotactile sensations, and to optimize product perceptual quality. We are a diverse team of acoustics and vibration experts, accomplished listeners, and creative problem solvers. We work daily with multi-functional teams on innovative solutions to complex engineering challenges. We are looking for a Noise & Vibration Researcher to join our team with a specialization in sensory science to expand our expertise in vibration perception for current and future products. While this position will have a focus on psychophysics, product acoustic validation will be part of the typical duties. The ideal candidate will have some background in acoustics, but any necessary acoustic training will be provided. Could this be you? Key Qualifications Experience in developing and applying technical tools and techniques in the area of sensory perception with a focus on vibrotactility Proven track record of collaborating with multi-functional teams to understand human response to auditory and haptic stimuli A strong interest in characterizing multi-sensory perception of intended haptics and unintended vibration sources Creative problem solver who thrives in a fast-paced, multi-tasking environment Useful but not required: history of high-volume consumer electronics validation, knowledge of acoustics and vibration principles and how motion of mechanical systems turns into radiated noise, accomplished listener with excellent hearing over the audible frequency range Description As a Noise & Vibration Researcher specializing in sensory perception, you will apply your experience in psychophysics, behavioral analytics, and basic inferential statistics to quantify human perception of feel and sound both objectively and subjectively. You will facilitate user studies, and establish thresholds in laboratory and factory environments. These will help you educate multi-functional teams to implement standard methodologies and oversee experiments to solidify new best practices. Your work will enable you to better identify root cause and mitigations for novel engineering challenges. You will work closely with partner facilities overseas, but the need to travel will be minimal. Education & Experience While an advanced degree in psychology, psychophysics, sensory perception, neuroscience, or related field is desirable, if you’ve followed a different path to expertise in psychophysics, we still want to hear from you! Additional Requirements Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Apple is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. Apple is a drug-free workplace. Role Number: 200428490

Residents will have the opportunity to attend machine learning and AI courses, learn from an Apple mentor closely involved in their program, collaborate with fellow residents, gain hands-on experience working on high-impact projects, publish in premier academic conferences, and partner with Apple teams across hardware, software, and services. Key Qualifications Proficiency in a programming language such as Python, Objective-C, C++, Swift, and/or R. Candidates should have experience completing a moderate-sized software project Demonstrated ability to connect and collaborate with others Ideal candidates will also have academic, research, or industry experience in one of the following: Natural Language Processing, Neuroscience, Information Retrieval/Search, Optimization and Computer Vision. Thesis, dissertation, capstone project, internship, co-op, and/or industry experience in these fields all qualify Description Our team focuses on new types of Machine Learning models and algorithms that work on sequential data such as language, conversations, speech and videos. It is composed of world class researchers with diverse experience in focus areas such as Deep Learning, Speech Recognition and Synthesis, Supervised, Semi-Supervised and Unsupervised Learning, Language Modeling (and conversational agents) and developing new ML Frameworks, among other things. A resident can expect to be tightly integrated with our researchers and find a rich environment for learning about and pushing the boundaries of Machine Learning research. As part of a team whose mandate is to do open, publishable research, it is our hope that the resident will lead and participate in writing their research as papers in the best Machine Learning journals such as NeurIPS, ICLR and ICML. In addition to the research exploration the resident will also be expected to work on the hands-on side of Machine Learning research such as implementing their algorithms in our frameworks, helping with scaling up their research algorithms and participating in open source releases of their code. Education & Experience Graduate degree in a STEM field or equivalent industry experience in software engineering Additional Requirements - We encourage you to submit a cover letter as part of your application explaining: What are your research interests? How do they apply to the specific Residency position you applied to? Why you would like to join the AI/ML residency program broadly? - Apple’s AI/ML residency is a one-year program starting in July 2023. Residents must be available to work full-time (40 hours/week) July 17, 2023 - July 12, 2024 APPLICATION DEADLINE: DECEMBER 7, 2022 Role Number: 200438165

jobTitle: Apple Home Product Systems QA Engineer
jobDescription: Summary Would you like to work on a dynamic team that is all about delivering a quality experience on some of the world’s most creative products? We are the Apple TV and HomePod Systems QA Team, and we are looking for a highly motivated, energetic, and experienced QA engineer with a passion for consumer electronics and technologies like Audio/Video, AirPlay, Wi-Fi, Precision Audio and Siri. You'll enjoy working on a team of diverse-minded Systems QA engineers as we take on new problems and help refine brand-new technologies for a simple and elegant user experience. You'll partner closely with the hardware teams as we develop the next generation of devices that seem almost magical. You'll also work with software engineering on planning for the new set of features that will take Apple TV and HomePod to the next level. You will be proud of your work through every step of the development cycle and will help make the products more flexible, reliable and easy to use. Come be a part of a team using creativity and innovation to test features that our customers love! Key Qualifications Minimum of 3 years in an end user quality-focused role. Experience with the development cycle of a customer-facing hardware product. Good understanding of QA methodologies, such as test planning, scheduling, and regression. Experience being accountable for the quality of a technical area and demonstrated understanding of how it works. Experience working with partners across different teams and organizations to clearly communicate status and raise critical issues. Ability to think analytically, reduce data sets, problem-solve, and innovate. Scripting experience in a high level, object-oriented programming language, such as Python. jobTitle: Apple Professional Learning Specialist - Bakersfield, CA
jobDescription: Summary The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. For over 40 years, we’ve had the privilege of working alongside educators around the world. From that experience, we know that educators with powerful technology can unlock the unique genius in every learner, so they can make a difference. As an Apple Professional Learning Specialist, you will help educational institutions transform their teaching and learning environments with Apple products. You will provide leadership and planning support, build professional learning plans, and offer hands-on instructional coaching and mentoring to support teachers in advancing their technology skills with an emphasis on innovation—to engage students in deeper learning. This is a full-time corporate position with Apple for approximately one year. This annual support position is located in Bakersfield, California. Key Qualifications Proven experience as both a teacher and leader at the K-12 level; Instructional design and coaching experience in a Higher Education setting or one-to-one learning environment is a plus. Familiarity with Common Core State Standards and content standards. Clear understanding of the fundamentals of instructional design. Exemplary leadership skills in the successful implementation of digital resources in instructing and classroom learning across multiple curricular areas. Experience improving basic skills and achievement across core content areas. Experience developing creative curriculums, specifically infusing digital resources to promote learning. Experience with professional development activities such as mentoring colleagues, offering workshops locally or nationally, presenting at conferences, etc. Experience delivering training and programs for students and parents on basic technology skills, the ethical and secure use of the Internet, and collaboration tools. Strong understanding of technology with hands-on knowledge of Apple products, software applications, and other education-related third party apps. Excellent knowledge and use of peripherals and apps to improve learning in areas such as math, science, social studies, English language arts and Special Education. Understanding of trends in the use of technology and national trends in education in general. Description In this role, you will: - Collaborate with leadership to develop an effective learning plan for professional learning that supports the goals of school districts and individual schools. - Deliver high quality plans for schools throughout the United States. - Customize professional learning based on individual plans for educators. - Handle both leadership and teacher professional learning to provide educators with the necessary skills and knowledge to help support the effective use of digital resources and Apple technology. - Provide professional learning as needed to individual schools and teachers using a variety of strategies. - Offer classroom support for teachers and students in their use of Apple technology. Education & Experience - Bachelor's degree required - Master's degree or Doctorate preferred Additional Requirements Proven experience as a classroom teacher, instructional coach and/or curriculum consultant Role Number: 200431058

jobTitle: Applied Biomechanics Researcher, Apple Design Team
jobDescription: Summary The Apple Design Team is seeking an Applied Biomechanics Researcher to support the development and design of future products. This is an active role where collaboration with an immense number of partners across the company is necessary. An ideal candidate has fluency across disciplines related to human experience, though focused expertise in biomechanics is necessary. They readily move between minute details and big ideas. Comfortable in any environment, their presence reassures others and solicits unfiltered feedback. They are technical, but also extremely intuitive and empathetic, capable of expressing objective evidence through compelling storytelling, championing the holistic human experience. Key Qualifications 3-5 years research experience: musculoskeletal/soft tissue/locomotion/exoskeleton biomechanics and/or 3-5 years research experience: sports biomechanics Prior experience working in industry is highly preferred. Prior experience working with designers and engineers is highly preferred. Description The Applied Biomechanics Researcher will be an integral part of an interdisciplinary research team within Design, generating insights to support product development. This role is responsible for framing questions, conducting studies, analyzing data, interpreting results, communicating actionable insights, and facilitating collaboration with cross-functional research teams. The team is expected to balance scientific curiosity, engineering practicality, and design sensibility. Some responsibilities include: • Work hands-on with prototypes. • Work with mechanical, electrical, and soft goods engineers on building novel and custom instrumentation. • In conducting studies, should have the ability to gather robust biomechanics data while gauging and incorporating subjective feedback, with the agility to adapt research methods • Data reduction, analysis, and interpretation. • Clear, concise, actionable communication of research to designers and cross-functional audiences. • Ability to zoom in and out - see the minute detail and big picture concurrently. Education & Experience Master’s Degree or PhD in related fields. Additional Requirements • Wide range of biomechanics toolboxes: 3D motion capture, inertia measurement unit (IMU), instrumented force/pressure measurements, electromyography (EMG), muscle oxygenation, indirect calorimetry, musculoskeletal modeling, finite element modeling for soft tissues. • Software: Matlab, Python, LabView, OpenSim. Please send your CV and a visual portfolio that demonstrates your previous research and development experiences. Role Number: 200396450

Summary At Apple’s Biomechanics Research Center we bring together area experts across a range of disciplines to deliver science-backed design insights for the development of hardware products. The Applied Biomechanics Researcher will bring the expertise to make the principles and techniques of biomechanics an integral part of development of future products. Summary The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it! Apple’s Sales organization generates the revenue needed to fuel our ongoing development of products and services. This in turn enriches the lives of hundreds of millions of people around the world. Our sales team is, in many ways, the face of Apple to our largest customers! At the end of the day, we are here to help enterprise businesses transform the way people work. We create a vision that can inspire customers to transform using Apple products. We provide support and collaborate closely with internal and external partners to create plans for solutions, and then help drive the execution of the solution. Key Qualifications No matter the audience, you are an expert at communicating. And, you’re cool under pressure. You make the sophisticated simple and you command an audience by bringing them along for the journey. You empower others to learn, to be curious and ultimately, share your passion for the Apple story. When challenged with sophisticated questions, you share your deep knowledge of how our hardware, software and services integrate. Empower others to learn, to be curious and ultimately, share your real passion for the Apple story. When challenged with complex questions, you share your deep knowledge of how our hardware, software and services integrate. Apple doesn’t cut corners, in products or in business. You bring the highest level of integrity, honesty, and accountability in all that you do, every single day. You are a trusted advisor who does what you say you’ll do – and always does what’s best for Apple. Do you see the world through the eyes of the customer by deeply understanding their business needs, challenges, and concerns? You obsess over how they experience our products and services? You not only meet our customers’ expectations, but you exceed them. Customer and partner needs can often be unique – but, you’re quick on your feet and connect and influence the right people both inside and outside of Apple. You’re a go to person with leadership, and are trusted and appropriate in tough situations. You can settle disputes, negotiations and lead the hard calls with minimal noise. You step up to conflicts and see them as opportunities to shine. You are only as strong as the people around you, so you know how to chip in to your team. Love a reciprocal environment with open dialogue and debate? Empower your teammates to do their life’s best work. When projects require extra support, you are eager to step up and bring your knowledge to the table. Relate well to all kinds of people – up, down, and sideways, inside and outside the organization. When faced with a challenging opportunity, you know who to connect with and when. People know you’re a real teammate and you know what it takes to win! Apple and third party solutions tackle sophisticated business problems in simple and innovative ways. You build daring and breakthrough strategies that truly craft the future. You do this by asking why and why not, both stripping out what is not crucial and identifying what is. By doing so, you are able to see what’s ahead and identify trends that will be essential for growth. Strive for excellence in everything you do. Due to changing priorities, urgent customer needs, or a final push to meet a quarterly forecast, you face the daily challenge of where to focus your time and energy. You have a don’t give up attitude, and finish, especially in the face of resistance or setbacks. You seize every opportunity and empower others to reach their goals along the way. Adapt to change and find the right path without necessarily having all of the pieces to the puzzle. At Apple, things aren’t always clear but you shift gears and thrive when asked to explore new ground, rather than waiting on others. Summary The ideal candidate has deep experience in the facilitation of art production workflows, balancing considerations for performance optimizations and quality, including working with custom engines. Summary At Apple, we work every day to create products that enrich people’s lives. Our platforms are highly-performant, deployed at scale, and setting new standards for enabling effective advertising while protecting user privacy. Launched in 2016, Search Ads is an easy, efficient and fast-growing platform for app discovery. With over 65% of all app downloads resulting directly from a search in the App Store, Search Ads is quickly becoming the app promotion platform of choice for iOS developers. Apple is a place where extraordinary people gravitate in order to do their best work. Together we craft products and experiences people once couldn’t have imagined — and now can’t imagine living without! If you’re excited by the idea of making a real impact, and joining a team where we pride ourselves in being one of the most diverse and inclusive companies in the world, a career with Apple might be your dream job! Apple Advertising Platforms is redefining advertising on mobile devices while reaching hundreds of millions of iPhone and iPad users around the world. With Apple Advertising, advertisers and publishers get access to the most engaged consumers in the market. We’re looking for an extraordinary Client Partner to join our Search Ads business. Summary The  Health group is looking for a Clinical Quality Assurance (CQA) Lead to implement and lead all aspects of a clinical compliance program, including a fit-for-purpose clinical Quality Management System. If you are passionate about the health space and want to have an incredible impact here at Apple, this could be the role for you. We are an efficient team who works closely together to establish relationships across multiple functional teams. We care deeply about getting amazing new products into our customers hands. Key Qualifications 8+ years of medical device, biotechnology or pharmaceutical industry experience in regulatory, clinical, or quality compliance roles 3+ years of leading CQA teams, including people management and setting strategy Familiarity with Agile software development practices and technical software development concepts and tools Track record of building, implementing and running a good clinical practices (GCP) compliance program globally Significant experience in leading or supporting interactions with regulatory health authorities in audits and submissions (e.g., BIMO, Notified Body audits, etc.) Strong working knowledge of US, EU, APAC, LATAM, ASEAN and other global regulations, standards, and guidance, particularly around GCP, including - but not limited to - 21 CFR 820, 21 CFR 812, 21 CFR 11, 21 CFR 50/54/56, ISO 14155, ICH guidance, EU MDR, MEDDEV clinical guidelines, China GCP, Japan GCP, etc. Previous experience with large research studies and clinical validation studies preferred, including deep understanding of innovative study concepts like decentralized clinical trials, virtual studies. Executive-level presentation experience (within companies and with auditors) to describe and defend fit-for-purpose quality management systems and evangelize clinical compliance concepts. Description You will represent the Apple Health Regulatory & Quality (RA/QA) organization on a diverse array of clinical studies to support Health features, and work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure that Apple is meeting key GCP requirements and expectations. This role will: - Be the Apple Health subject matter authority on Global GCP requirements (ICH, US, EU, JGCP and other regulations) and how they apply to the business, including studies and processes - Develop and manage a clinical Quality Management System (cQMS) including processes to monitor and review Trial Master File documents, and developing metrics - Review key study documents (Clinical Investigation Plans/ Reports, Informed Consent, Study Risk, etc.) - Create, manage and coordinate completion of clinical evaluation plans and reports in accordance with the Medical Device Regulation (2017/45) in the EU, including PSUR/ PMCFs and supporting documents - Support Investigational Device Exemption (IDE) assessments and documentation in accordance with 21 CFR 812 in the US - Maintain a global GCP program, identifying and ensuring continuous compliance to global GCP regulations, standards and guidance - Identify and continuously monitor global standards, regulations and guidance associated with clinical evaluation and validation (ex: MEDDEV guidances in the EU) - Create and implement an internal clinical audit program including data integrity audits, general GCP audits, clinical CAPA audits - Assist and / or lead (depending on scope) Sponsor GCP regulatory authority inspections (EU, Japan, etc.) - Support Clinical Operations teams by providing guidance and input into clinical study setup, CRO selection, CRO management, data management, clinical documentation (including TMF) and other activities - Collaborate closely with the Health Quality and Clinical Operations teams on supplier qualification, training implementation, internal audits, documentation management, tool validations and implementation of the clinical quality system Education & Experience B.S. ME/EE/BME/CS degree or equivalent in any life sciences discipline Additional Requirements - Expertise in development and execution of digital health clinical studies and trials - Proven background in being autonomous and being able to clearly work towards establish goals and initiatives with minimal oversight. - Working as part of a focused project team. - Shown competence in determination of appropriate global regulatory requirements for new products or product changes. - Strong organizational and leadership skills. - Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Summary Do you love understanding every detail of how new technologies work? Join the team that serves as Apple’s nerve center, our Information Systems and Technology group. There are countless ways you’ll contribute here, whether you’re coordinating technology needs for product launches, designing music solutions for retail locations, or ensuring the strength of in-store Wi-Fi connections. From Apple Pay to the Apple website to our data centers around the globe, you’ll help design and manage the massive systems that countless employees and customers rely on every day. You’ll also build custom tools for employees, empowering them to solve complex problems on their own. Join our team, and together we’ll explore all the ways to improve how Apple operates, freeing our employees to do what they do best: craft magical experiences for our customers. The people here at Apple don't just build products - they also provide tools and services to enhance the way employees collaborate at Apple. We believe that the Apple Employee is the Apple’s first customer! The IS&T Collaboration & Productivity team equips Apple Employees with the tools, training, information, and support in order to efficiently coordinate, communicate, and collaborate across their many responsibilities each work day. Our main focus is simple: enable Apple Employees to be more productive. Key Qualifications 7+ years of experience with defining business-critical systems and developing products which scale to serve the needs across geography and organization Experience working with Global/Regional teams Strong time-management and organizational skills, able to deliver multiple projects of varying lengths, while meeting quality standards and deadlines Experience with Business Intelligence Tools (like Tableau) and conducting the analysis of data to advise both high-level strategy and day-to-day tactics Proficiency in translating (qualitative) "wants and needs" from non-technical users into (quantitative) functional engineering requirements for Business and Technical Documentation Unwavering ethics, inspiring ability to rally a team in the face of adversity, and unparalleled customer support focus Experience with respectfully handling multiple commitments/critical issues with customers, internal leadership, staff and operations Previous team leadership/management experience preferred Previous experience with software development is a plus Previous experience as an Engineering/Technical Project Manager is a plus Description We are seeking a Product Manager who will be a crucial component of a unique team that is responsible for defining, researching, and delivering Collaboration and Productivity tools to all the Business Units at Apple. Some of the tools we deliver provide features to enhance large segments of our daily workflow; this includes tools built internally or externally, and focus areas such as Meeting Experience, File Sync & Share, Chat, Content Collaboration, and Community Management. In this role, you will be leading the management and creation of tools to support and reshape how employees work together. As new business requirements evolve, you will craft the story, explore alternative solutions and define the product strategy and vision! You should possess finely-tuned Critical Thinking skills and have significant breadth and depth as a best-in-class Product Manager. IN ADDITION, YOU WILL: - Obsess over the Apple employee user experience of IS&T Collaboration and Productivity tools/services - Navigate the product development lifecycle; including requirements collection, evaluation and analysis of tools/features, and company-wide deployment to users - Eloquent sophisticated technical issues and organizational/political interdependencies in a cogent, concise, objective and timely manner to Executive Management - Thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic "startup" environment with minimal direction, agile responsiveness, limited resources, and a relentless demand for dispassionate critical-thinking and creative problem-solving - Influence multi-functional teams (and their leadership) across Apple to make decisions that enhance the productivity of the Apple Employee Education & Experience Bachelors degree in computer science, information management, or a technical field or Master’s degree or equivalent. Role Number: 200434439

Apple's Strategic Data Solutions (SDS) team is looking for a talented individual who is passionate about crafting, implementing, and operating analytical solutions that have direct and measurable impact to Apple and its customers. As an SDS data scientist, you will employ predictive modeling and statistical analysis techniques to build end-to-end solutions for improving security, fraud prevention, and operational efficiency across the company, from manufacturing to fulfillment to apps and services. Apple's dedication to customer privacy, the adversarial nature of fraud, and the enormous scale of the business present exciting challenges to traditional machine learning and data science techniques. On this team, you will push the limits of existing data science methods while delivering tangible business value. This position is located in Seattle, WA. Key Qualifications Practical experience with and theoretical understanding of algorithms for classification, regression, clustering, and anomaly detection Working knowledge of relational databases, including SQL, and large-scale distributed systems such as Hadoop and Spark Ability to implement data science pipelines and applications in a general programming language such as Python, Scala, or Java Ability to comprehend and debug complex systems integrations spanning toolchains and teams Ability to extract meaningful business insights from data and identify the stories behind the patterns Excellent presentation skills, distilling complex analysis and concepts into concise business-focused takeaways Creativity to engineer novel features and signals, and to push beyond current tools and approaches Description • Engage with business teams to find opportunities, understand requirements, and translate those requirements into technical solutions • Design data science approach, applying tried-and-true techniques or developing custom algorithms as needed by the business problem • Collaborate with data engineers and platform architects to implement robust production real-time and batch decisioning solutions • Ensure operational and business metric health by monitoring production decision points • Investigate adversarial trends, identify behavior patterns, and respond with agile logic changes • Communicate results of analyses to business partners and executives • Research new technologies and methods across data science, data engineering, and data visualization to improve the technical capabilities of the team Education & Experience • Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Operations Research or related field; or • Ph.D. in Math, Engineering, Economics, or hard science with data science fellowship; or • M.S. in related field with 3+ years experience applying data science to real business problems Role Number: 200385282

Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. You will help define test strategy and lead the creation of automated tests for functional, system, regression and end-to-end testing. Summary The Technology Development Group is looking for help to drive breakthrough developments in deep learning and computer vision problems. We are looking for people with a passion for applying deep learning to help blur the line between real and virtual content. Help us drive augmented reality experiences to the next level by converging on neural network architectures and optimizations. We promise hands-on work in an innovative team and where you will be part of building the next big thing. Key Qualifications Passionate about State-of-the-Art in Deep Learning Passionate about Augmented Reality Solid fundamentals in Machine Learning Great interest or background in Computer Vision Great interest in optimizing neural networks for running on embedded devices Proficiency in Python Proficiency in C/C++ Self-motivated and great teammate Description We are the Technology Development Group that is responsible for many of the key algorithms in ARKit and beyond. We are looking for talented engineers who are passionate about building products for millions of customers around the world. You’ll be working on cutting-edge technology and develop algorithms that enable a high-quality user experience across a range of tentpole use cases and applications. As a part of our team, you will closely collaborate with HW engineers (cameras, silicon, electrical engineering, product design) and other technology development software teams (computer graphics, video engineering, data generation/annotation, drivers/OS). You can make a difference by researching and prototyping novel deformable object tracking algorithms beyond the state of the art and/or by optimizing the performance of real-time algorithms running on Apple silicon. Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants. Education & Experience PhD in Computer Vision or similar, alternatively a comparable industry career, with significant experience in state-of-the-art Computer Vision, Machine Learning and Pattern Recognition fields. Role Number: 200430411

Summary The Deep Learning Research engineer will work in a small and dynamic team to design and implement cutting edge computer vision algorithms for Apple products. Key Qualifications 2+ Years of industry experience in applied research in the field of deep learning and computer vision Experience in Deep Learning in one of the following: object detection, segmentation, tracking, pose estimation, action recognition, differentiable rendering Nice to have: Experience in Deep Learning for object tracking, domain adaptation, uncertainty prediction Solid Python skills and deep understanding of deep learning frameworks and workflow Experience in working with large data sets and developing infrastructure pipelines Strong fundamentals in 3D geometry Description The Video Computer Vision group is looking for a Deep Learning Research engineer. In this position, you will work together with similar minds in a unique development team where your skills and expertise will be put into the Apple products. Education & Experience PhD (or masters with at least 3 years working experience) in machine learning, computer vision, or robotics vision, Role Number: 200337323

jobTitle: Demand and Acquisition Marketing Manager, Global Channel Marketing, Ad Platforms
jobDescription: Summary At Apple, we believe in the power of technology to enrich people's lives. For the Ad Platforms team, this means creating digital advertising solutions that benefit marketers and enhance the experience people have on Apple devices. All with the same commitment to privacy you expect from Apple. Because when advertising is done right, it benefits everyone. Apple Search Ads helps developers drive discovery of their apps across the App Store. Display ads on Apple News and Stocks help marketers promote their products alongside trusted content in a brand-safe environment. Join us and become a part of a team driven by values that put customers first while helping businesses grow. We’re looking for a results-oriented marketer with proven success developing B2B programs that drive demand — from awareness through acquisition. Reporting to the Global Channel Marketing Lead, you will build out and scale our demand marketing strategy, identify key channels and tactics, and drive acquisition program execution. Are you a hands-on creative problem-solver who loves diving into the details and optimizing the marketing funnel? If so, we want to talk with you! Key Qualifications 10+ years experience leading large-scale B2B demand and acquisition marketing initiatives across direct, partner, paid, and earned channels. Knowledge of the digital advertising landscape and prior experience with trade marketing, agency education, and marketing to the SMB segment is beneficial. Experience building, testing, and optimizing digital marketing channels and tactics to achieve business objectives. Self-starter who works through ambiguity, leads through influence, and drives focus. Demonstrates creative and critical thinking — adept at developing an informed point of view, discussing and debating ideas, and adapting to evolving needs. Exceptional collaborator, with proven ability to work cross-functionally and across geographically distributed teams to solve complex problems, define marketing technical and measurement requirements, establish relevant performance metrics, and analyze results. Strong written and verbal communication skills, attention to detail, and project management capabilities. Familiar with performance marketing KPIs and using data and insights to inform decision making. Skilled at shaping content strategy to align with marketing objectives. Possess unquestionable personal code of ethics and integrity. Description The Channel Marketing team relies on extensive market and product knowledge to inform program initiatives that drive awareness, education, and adoption of our advertising solutions. The Demand and Acquisition Marketing Manager will be responsible for building scaled lead capture, nurture, and acquisition initiatives. Day-to-day, this person will collaborate with Apple business, marketing, analytics, and technical teams to develop and optimize our marketing demand funnel. They’ll develop marketing briefs informed by target audience insights and business objectives, shape content strategy, work with partners to move projects forward, and project manage ongoing campaigns to improve performance. Additional responsibilities may include defining requirements for technical teams, evaluating and testing new demand formats and touch points, reporting on campaign effectiveness and business impact to senior leaders, and more. Education & Experience BA/BS in Marketing, Communications, Business Administration, Journalism, or related field. MBA desirable. Additional Requirements Some travel required. Role Number: 200439188

Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. Apple products are as beautiful on the inside as they are on the outside. Inside every one of our products, are some of the world's most challenging consumer PCBA and Flex designs. Imagine yourself as a select member of the team that brings these assemblies from concept to high volume manufacturing. Key Qualifications The PCBA DFM Engineer or Technologist will have a deep level of creativity and curiosity about materials science and electronics packaging at all levels. 2+ years of research or process development experience in an applicable field. Familiarity with the properties and process used in microelectronics fabrication and PCBA assembly. Aptitude to work with a multi-functional team to define requirements and suitable metrics for the performance of new products and process. Proven ability to self-manage and deliver results in a pure development role. Capability and willingness to travel frequently, i.e. >20%. Description DFM PCBA Engineers at Apple are specialists in high quality, reliable electronics manufacturing. We spend the majority of our time working in the “New Product Introduction” space, which is the time a product spends growing from proof of concept until it is ready for mass production. You will be assigned to a product and be responsible for the manufacturability of its design through application of our design guidelines. You will build the assembly process and design the PCB panelization. You will use structured problem solving and data analysis methods to solve problems when things go wrong. You will share your new discoveries with your peers and to file patents for novel ideas that you develop. To make the best products, you’ll interact with specialists from other teams like Product Design, EE, PCB Layout, Program Office, Reliability, TPM, Component Quality, Capex and others. You will communicate frequently and effectively to peers and leadership teams to keep them apprised of the status of your product. You will support (in person or remotely) the factory and our in region teams when your product is getting built. Education & Experience A degree in an engineering discipline (mechanical, chemical, electrical or materials science) is desired and a strong, directly applicable background will be considered as well. Additional Requirements Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. If you’d like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant, please click here. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants. Apple will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law. Apple participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations as required by law. Apple is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. Role Number: 200381311

We believe teams are most effective when they feel connected, inspired, and engaged. As a part of the Design Operations team within Product & Design — a large, global creative group within Apple Services —you will play a key role in how we engage employees by driving onboarding, learning, knowledge-sharing, and cultural engagement initiatives for our diverse product management and multi-disciplinary design organization. In this role you will heavily collaborate with peers, employees, and leadership across Product & Design, as well as partner teams such as Recruiting and People (HR). As a part of the Design Operations team within Product & Design — a large, global creative group within Apple Services — you will help us prioritize the focus of our recruiting partners, engage and attract top talent, drive referrals, and evolve our hiring practices to meet the ever-changing needs of this diverse product management and multi-disciplinary design organization. This may include tracking and prioritizing our organization’s hiring needs, leading emerging talent allocations, planning recruiting events, driving referrals, serving as a point-of-contact for questions and blocking issues, maintaining documentation and communication on our processes and workflows, and providing reporting - Develop execution plans for new initiatives, identify and secure required resources, and provide hands-on delivery of results - Create delivery frameworks that allow us to plan for scale - Implement methods of collecting feedback and measuring the results of your programs - Apply takeaways to continuously iterate, adjust, and improve our programs and practices Education & Experience BA/BS or equivalent Additional Requirements - Proficiency in creating, collaborating, and managing data in spreadsheets (Numbers, Excel, Airtable, etc) - Skilled in designing Keynote or Powerpoint presentations - Knowledge and ease working in collaboration tools (ex: Quip, Slack) - Experience collaborating and driving projects with distributed teams (ie - not all in one location) - Flexibility in schedule, allowing you to work with employees across timezones - Ability travel ~10% of the time Role Number: 200394378

Summary Does making the next great technology product excite you? Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, our new ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. We bring passion and dedication to our job and when you are a part of that team there's no telling what you could accomplish. Design Verification Engineers at Apple are responsible for verifying the functionality and performance of Apple’s premier SOCs. This is a critical job within Apple's Hardware Technology and we'd love to have you join us. Key Qualifications Skilled in many aspects of digital verification such as constrained random verification process, functional coverage, code coverage, assertion methodology & philosophy. Knowledge of Verilog/System Verilog, digital simulation and debug. Knowledge of computer architecture and digital design fundamentals. Ability to work independently to deliver the project goals. Exposure to UVM is desired. Experience with C/C++, assembly is a plus. Experience with perl, python or similar scripting language. Excellent interpersonal skills and the dream to take on diverse challenges. Description As part of a very talented team you will be at the heart of the chip design effort collaborating with all disciplines (vertical product model). You own ensuring the quality of the SOC or an IP or subsystem. This requires you to review design and architecture specifications and work closely with design & micro-architecture teams. A key component to the job is understanding the functional & performance goals of the design and you use this knowledge to test effectively. You develop test plans, tests & coverage plans as well as define our next generation verification methodology & test benches. It's required that you communicate and collaborate with design, architecture and software to understand the use cases and corner conditions and drive test cases. We also require additional responsibilities such as running and triaging regressions, tracking bugs, and analyzing coverage to achieve top results. Education & Experience BSEE or BSCS required, Master’s or PhD desired. Role Number: 200204770

Summary There’s the typical job. Then there’s a career at Apple. Where we'll challenge you to defy routine. To explore the far reaches of the possible. To travel unchartered paths. And to be a part of something far bigger than yourself. Because around here, changing the world just comes with the job description. We are looking for a world-class Designer for our Media Products team! This is a role for the visual designer, communicator and problem solver who wants to have their hands in several things at once; who can deliver end-to-end integrated creative solutions that resonate in culture; and who can collaborate well with internal and external partners You are enthusiastic about culture and lifestyle, with an eye for detail and a blend of creative and craft-focused skills. This position will work closely with the Creative Director, art directors and producers to ideate, develop and produce global content campaigns across all channels and platforms. Key Qualifications Proven ability to create and direct high-quality campaign creative for either marketing or on platform content Fluent in Digital, Social, AV on product creative and top of class design benchmarks Experience delivering big ideas for subscription businesses a plus A minimum of 7 years significant experience with increasing responsibility Experience in a quick moving and cross-functional focused environment Collaborative and team oriented approach International experience or experience working with global teams Experience working directly with talent and creators to collaborate on campaigns Experience managing a high volume of creative and campaign types in parallel Description - We develop big, cut through ideas that get results - Articulate and sell these big ideas to senior leadership in the services organization and beyond - Maintain momentum around creative concepts, as a core part of the team that is responsible for bringing them into the world - Cross-functional relationship building to ensure alignment on deliverable quality and creative direction - We develop multi-media extensions that extend the campaign across the Apple ecosystem - Find and develop working relationships with new creative and production vendors, as well as strengthening partnerships with current vendors, to conceive/execute campaigns Education & Experience Bachelors/equivalent experience preferred Additional Requirements Portfolio demonstrating proficiency in delivering strong creative ideas across digital, social and/or static and print media required Role Number: 200267937

Summary Prototyping is an exploratory design team. We design software to explore what new hardware might bring to our current and future products. It is our job to invent and propose new features and sometimes entirely new products. Over the past decade we have incubated products like iPad, Pencil, and Apple TV Siri Remote. We pioneered force and haptics for Multi-Touch trackpads, iPhone, and Apple Watch. We were instrumental in the interface design and development of multi-camera systems, LiDAR, TrueDepth, Face ID, Animoji, and depth photography. We express our ideas through pictures, animation, video and code. The work we do is on a 3–5-year timescale — if it makes it into a product... We are looking for people with a variety of capabilities and interests. We are not filling a specific role, we are looking for people to add something special to our team. We are open to people with any background and any amount of experience. It does not matter to us what tool you use or what medium you work in. We are interested in your ideas and how you express them. Key Qualifications • We don’t expect you to be able to do all of these things. If you have any of these capabilities, we would like to hear from you • Visual Design 2D or 3D. Create static visual communication artifacts. Important aspects are form, color, alignment, type, and layout. Illustrated or rendered. You will make things with aesthetic breadth beyond the Apple style. • Animation 2D or 3D. Use motion in a complementary and tasteful way to direct attention and describe interactions. You will create motion that strike a balance between artful — how it feels, and practical — what it communicates. • Interactive Prototyping 2D or 3D. Make something people can try with taps, swipes, or clicks. Not necessarily an app — whatever communicates an idea. • Interaction Design. Design new affordances and capabilities that are discoverable, easy to perform, and provide clear feedback. You will pay attention to how everything you make responds before, during, and after interaction. Description For everyone on the team, these core values are important to us: • Communication. You can explain your work to people from different disciplines. You provide constructive feedback. You encourage dialogue and inclusion. • Open. You accept feedback on your work and act on it. You are willing to try anything – even things you don’t believe in. “Yes, and...” • Reliable. You do what you say you will do, when you said you would do it. When things change, you tell people. • Invention. Unexpected ideas and solutions. Inspiration and techniques from other fields or disciplines. • Initiative. Ideas and concepts no one asked for. You just jump in and make things. You do not wait for instructions or need permission. • Divergence. You try multiple approaches and learn from them before deciding what to do next. Willing to share concepts that might challenge or displease. Willing to keep unpopular options alive to see where they go. Role Number: 200345998

Summary At Apple, we take pride in surprising and delighting our customers with innovative products and services that enrich their lives. The people here at Apple explore ideas that create new markets and revolutionize how people live. Bring your passion, dedication, and expertise, and discover the difference you can make. Key Qualifications Functional technical skills to translate requests for tests of hardware, software and sensor technologies into test execution instructions. Sound functional understanding of autonomous hardware and software, including servers, compute technologies, operating systems, sensors, networking, and the software environment. An intermediate working knowledge of software development practices and related tools, such as Git and Github, is a requirement. Ability to read and debug Bash and Python at an intermediate proficiency strongly desired. Knowledge or proficiency with JSON and SQL a plus. Command of tools such as Confluence, Jira, and data visualization tools. Effective communicator, both when writing and speaking. Able to communicate technical information clearly, tailoring the message for the audience. Ability to translate technical descriptions of instructions or expected behaviors from software engineers and develop detailed instructions to produce the desired result. Possess a keen eye for context clues when provided with ambiguous language or requests that are out of scope. Skilled at expectation setting, negotiation and conflict resolution with partners and coworkers. A safety-first mindset; identifies, reports, and ensures the documentation of issues that may require investigation or critical attention. Creates detailed briefs and skilled at modeling data to capture program requirements, develop training criteria, projects, and roadmaps. Description In this role, you will manage, prioritize and coordinate the execution of tests of autonomous systems based on requests from multi-disciplinary engineering teams. You will schedule and supervise a diverse set of testing programs, including hardware and software development, and validation activities. You will work with hardware, test and safety engineers, software developers, analytics, logistics coordinators and support teams, and management to effectively guide the work of a team of test engineers and system operators. You will monitor and coordinate resources with focuses on effectiveness, efficiency and accuracy, ensuring processes are documented, and safety guidelines are followed. Using your excellent written and verbal communication skills, you will deconflict competing priorities, ensuring the most critical work is completed as expected, and report on the team’s successes and opportunities. You will continuously look for opportunities to enhance process, systems and tools, by giving data driven feedback to engineering teams in order to highlight opportunities, bugs, and deficiencies. You are a natural leader and excel at providing technical guidance to groups through written and verbal communications. You find yourself at ease in fast paced and demanding environments, are curious and hungry to learn, and self-motivated and driven to deliver results with minimal oversight. Education & Experience Degree in STEM field preferred, or relevant experience Additional Requirements This role requires working onsite in the Santa Clara Valley area following Apple’s strategy for onsite work. Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Summary Do you love understanding every detail of how new technologies work? Join the team that serves as Apple’s nerve center, our Information Systems and Technology group. There are countless ways you’ll contribute here, whether you’re coordinating technology needs for product launches, designing music solutions for retail locations, or ensuring the strength of in-store Wi-Fi connections. From Apple Pay to the Apple website to our data centers around the globe, you’ll help design and manage the massive systems that countless employees and customers rely on every day. You’ll also build custom tools for employees, empowering them to solve complex problems on their own. Join our team, and together we’ll explore all the ways to improve how Apple operates, freeing our employees to do what they do best: craft magical experiences for our customers. Are you a passionate operations engineer? Want to work on solving large scale problems? Come join us to help build best in class CI/CD solutions and in implementing sophisticated software applications across Corporate Systems Engineering at Apple. Our DevOps engineering team develops and deploy software which ensures that Apple’s corporate applications are delivered accurately, reliably and with speed. We support both open source and home-grown technologies to provide internal Apple developers with the best possible CI/CD platform. In this role you will have the unique opportunity to own and improve tooling for best of the class large-scale CI/CD platform and help build modern software systems! The DevOps engineering team is part of the engineering operations team for corporate systems. This team is directly responsible to build, manage and expand on tools that enable software releases in a fast paced enterprise environment. We operate in on-premise, private, and public cloud (AWS, GCP etc.) environments. As a DevOps Engineer, you will be partnering closely with software development and infrastructure teams. And, be responsible for building and supporting CI/CD platforms, automating repeatable infrastructure needs, environment buildout, software build and releases, creating automated solutions, installing and configuring application software, and upkeep of systems through patching, upgrades, monitoring, and maintenance support. Key Qualifications Experience designing and working with modern Continuous integration and deployment solutions. 2-3 years of experience in DevOps/SRE, systems engineering, build/release/deployment automation, etc. Experience with hosted services in a large scale enterprise environmen. Implementing applications in private/public cloud infrastructure and container technologies, like Kubernetes and Docker. Exceptional analytical and troubleshooting skills in sophisticated Unix/Linux systems environment and applications implementations. Design and build CI/CD pipeline with Terraform, CloudFormation, Ansible, and Kubernetes toolset (e.g, kubectl, kustomize). Excellent understanding of microservices architecture. Develop full-fledged software tooling to deliver programmable infrastructure & environments (infrastructure as code). Consistent track record with writing programs using a high-level programming languages or scripting, such Java, Python, Shell, Golang, etc. Experience with logging infrastructure and using tools such as Splunk, Logstash, or Kibana. Experience with networking load balancers such as Ngnix, Netscaler, HAProxy. Experience with public cloud (AWS, GCP, etc.) platforms through migrations, scaling operations etc. Background building distributed, server-based infrastructure supporting volumes of transactions at scale in a critically important environment. Proven track record with working in a small, focused teams to complete critical achievements under pressure with tight deadlines. Experience with Kafka, MongoDB, Cassandra and Oracle is highly desirable. Passion for driving automation into how software development and delivery is done. Experience on Mac OS, iOS (mobile apps) desirable. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. In-Depth knowledge on AWS services including VPC, IAM, EC2, EKS, CloudWatch, S3, RDS, Route53, EMR. Experience in similar services for GCP is preferred. Working experience with Spinnaker or Tekton. AWS Cloud Architect and/or Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA) certifications are highly desired. Description Working in the team will expose you to a variety of challenges. Our team enables CI/CD capabilities for large numbers of applications by building, tuning and supporting highly available system. You will be working closely with U.S. and India based teams in a multi-vendor resourcing model. As a member of the tea, you will be empowered to work across multiple tools to improve and expand the capabilities the team has to offer! This may include: - Design and implement new software to streamline manual operations - Triage production issues along with other operational team members - Conduct root cause analysis of critical issues - Expand the capacity and performance of the system - Maintain primarily Linux and other types of systems The ideal candidate will be a self-motivated, hands-on, dynamic and detail oriented individual with a strong technical background. Education & Experience Bachelor’s in Computer Science or equivalent. Role Number: 200381723

Summary Marcom is Apple’s Global Marketing Communications group. The Marcom 3DVM team manages the development of physical deliverables in support of the Marcom group’s initiatives and creative intent. Our responsibilities include developing and deploying complex visual merchandising fixtures, furniture, and experience solutions for Apple’s worldwide retail and channel partners. Apple is looking for a Digital Artist with experience in rendering, modeling, and animating environments and/or consumer products, sculptures, lighting, and furniture to partner with and support our the 3D Visual Merchandising Design team. This role will provide visualization support for our multi-disciplinary group of designers focused on creating innovative and inspiring retail experiences. You will be responsible for visualizing the work from the creative team throughout the design phases: from initial digital concept sketches to high quality visuals and/or animations for stakeholder presentations to detail models/renders for creative intent hand-off to vendors for final production. Projects of the team vary from installations, displays, and experiential environments for Apple in various retail settings. Key Qualifications At least 7-9 years of design experience in related field You have the ability to approach design problems with creativity and passion Excellent visualization design skills, proven through a portfolio of work Proficiency in 3D modeling and visualization software on Mac OS platforms (Rhino, Cinema 4D and Keyshot preferred) Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite Motion graphics and animation experience req. Real-time rendering experience a plus Knowledgeable in manufacturing and prototyping process and general construction and engineering principles Extraordinary eye for detail, lighting and materials, with an ability to create photo realistic visuals Highly collaborative, with strong communication skills and the ability to articulate ideas in a clear and concise manner You are adept at time management and organization and able to work within tight timeframes Description Provide iterative visualization support through the design phases, to meet objectives on projects that span architecture, art installation, industrial design, communications and experience design. Work closely and collaboratively with a team of designers to execute against project briefs and assigned tasks. Partner with the creatives to unearth the most compelling imagery to support the project. Create hi-quality photorealistic visuals (renderings and/or animations) for stakeholder presentations as well as produce/edit motion content to support the work Some motion content editing required to help support project presentations and capture project overview upon completion Support the creative visualization needs for design development and/or intent packages for production and fabrication. Regularly review creative work with the team’s senior creative staff to get feedback on direction and ensure alignment with other activities in the group. Participate in presentations or meetings as appropriate. Summary Join our team at Apple developing complex digital IPs for Apple’s custom mixed-signal integrated circuits! We have already shipped hundreds of millions of chips into Apple’s existing product lines and are developing new chips for future product lines! As a member of our mixed-signal ASIC team, you will be responsible for crafting sophisticated digital IPs for Apple power conversion and system management IC’s. You will work with the system architects, product teams, verification engineers, and analog designers, crafting block level specifications and implementing the designs. You will own the creation of the blocks, and take them through the concept, implementation, and validation phases, and then into mass production. Learn and use state of the art digital ASIC development flows to implement your designs. We supply silicon to Apple’s industry leading hardware development teams and collaborate closely with them. We have a close-knit, robust team in need of enthusiastic digital design engineers to develop new ASIC IP’s. We pride ourselves for being an especially diverse team that values innovative approaches to deliver creativity, high productivity, and industry leading results. Join us in building Apple’s next generation products. Do you want to be a part of building the “surprise and delight” in Apple’s future products? Key Qualifications Three or more years developing digital IP’s for SoC’s or mixed signal IC’s. Proven track record shipping quality designs on schedule. Experience with synthesis and static timing tools. Expertise in Clock Domain Crossing design and verification techniques. Familiarity with power estimation tools and techniques. Familiarity with silicon development milestones and project resource management. Solid understanding of low power design techniques, including clock and power gating. Description • Deliver complex digital IPs, meeting schedule, area, power, and performance targets. • Collaborate in developing precise design specifications for digital control blocks. • Implement FSM’s and other control logic in System Verilog. • Collaborate with managers and program managers to track progress and gauge tapeout readiness. • Work with DV teams to create verification plans. • Work with silicon validation team in developing lab validation and qualification plans. Education & Experience BSEE/MSEE preferred. Role Number: 200245728

jobTitle: Digital Experiences Marketing Manager, Commercial Marketing
jobDescription: Summary Apple’s Commercial Marketing team is seeking a Marketing Manager to define and implement the strategic vision of digital experiences for our Hero Products in over 500 Apple Retail stores globally, including content and capabilities needed to support the cross-channel Apple Retail customer journey. We are looking for someone who has demonstrated experience developing and managing innovative strategies and campaigns that drive customer acquisition, conversion, loyalty, and brand equity across digital, traditional, and physical channels. The ideal candidate is highly innovative, solution oriented, insights driven and able to drive marketing initiatives forward in an ambiguous environment across multiple organizations. Key Qualifications 7+ years experience in Retail (online and stores) and/or marketing experience preferred Proven experience leading, managing and measuring large-scale marketing initiatives Strong eye for business, with the ability to comfortably dive into any internal or external research, develop a deep understanding, incorporate into strategy, and implement execution. Expert at simplifying the complex with a highly strategic mentality. Self-starter with incredible drive to problem solve, develop creative solutions and work through ambiguity to drive clarity. Experience in establishing clear goals and success metrics Able to connect dots across information, work streams, and people to inform the work A strength to influence in a matrixed organization, with capacity to mobilize, influence, and inspire teams without direct authority. Extraordinary storyteller with strong written and verbal communication skills; strong at building and delivering compelling presentations High attention to detail and obsesses over customer experience. Description - Define a clear vision for the role that Hero Product digital experiences play for shoppers in Apple Retail, in partnership with Stores and Online merchandising teams. - Shape and transform the strategy and experience of Hero Product digital experiences using insights, commercial needs and addressing customer journey gaps. - Author briefs and influence key partners to deliver against strategic vision of Hero Product digital experiences, while meeting deadlines, adhering to budget requirements, and incorporating future roadmap capabilities. - Collaborate with cross-functional teams across Retail to ensure Hero Product digital experiences are supplementary to other key cross-channel Retail touchpoints. - Determine relevant metrics, track/report performance of digital experiences and pivot strategy as needed based on performance results. Education & Experience Bachelor’s degree in relevant subject preferred but not required Apple’s most important resource, our soul, is our people.
