Summary Do you have a passion for crafting entirely new solutions? As part of our Digital Design Engineering group, you’ll take imaginative and revolutionary ideas and determine how to turn them into reality! You and your team will apply engineering fundamentals and start from scratch if needed, bringing forward-thinking ideas to the real world. Join us, and you’ll help design the tools that allow us to bring customers experiences they’ve never before envisioned. You will be part of an exciting silicon design group that is responsible for designing pioneering ASICs. We have an extraordinary opportunity for Digital Layout Designers! In this highly visible role, you will be a member of Apple’s custom layout team, working on the latest technology nodes to create extraordinary custom digital macros, libraries, etc. This is a fast paced work environment with endless learning opportunities working in the design team with members of integration, CAD, circuit and technology engineering. Key Qualifications We are looking for applicants with 5+ years experience in custom layout design of deep SubMicron CMOS circuits used in high performance microprocessors. Experience designing low noise, low power resistors, capacitors, pad IOs, ESD structures, datapaths, memory structures, etc. High level proficiency in layout floorplanning, standard cell planning and hierarchical layout assembly. Good understanding of issues with RC delay, electromigration, self heating and cross capacitance. Recognize failure prone circuit and layout structures, dedicatedly work with designers for the best approach to problems. Great skills on interpretation of CALIBRE DRC, ERC, LVS, etc. reports. Knowledge of MENTOR GRAPHICS or CADENCE layout tools. Scripting skills in PERL or SKILL or AMPLE are considered a plus, but not required. Excellent communication skills and able to work with multi-functional teams. Description Imagine yourself at the center of our SOC design effort, collaborating with all fields, playing a strategic role of getting functional products to millions of customers quickly. You will have the opportunity to integrate and come-up with new ideas, as well as work with a team of hardworking engineers. As a member of the layout team of the microprocessor group, you will be responsible to deliver PDV clean layout, including the following: - Designing complex layout for mixed signal, and digital circuits in deep SubMicron CMOS technologies. - Reviewing and analyzing floorplans and complex circuits with circuit designers. - Running a complete set of design verification tools available on megacells completed. - Working with the circuit design team to plan, schedule work and negotiate layout tradeoffs as needed. - Interpretation of LVS, DRC and ERC report to find the fastest way to complete layouts. - Exceed engineering specifications and expectations. - Use advanced CAD tools, mask design knowledge to layout corrections and robust physical design representation of circuits. Education & Experience BS Degree, or equivalent. Additional Requirements Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants. Role Number: 200332176

Summary Join the Apple Store Online Digital Experience and Merchandising team, and play a key role in defining the digital shopping experience for our customers worldwide. As Merchandising Specialist, Commercial Programs, you will be responsible for the merchandising of Apple Retail’s commercial and ownership programs (Apple Trade In, Apple Card, Apple Card Monthly Installments, Carrier financing, and related promotions), as well as iPhone related merchandising initiatives across all our digital platforms (Web, MOW, App). The right candidate must have demonstrated the ability to deliver and execute merchandising briefs, merchandising story telling, and continuous analysis of shopper-led, data driven insights, with a meticulous test and learn approach. The successful candidate has a customer centric mindset, is able to set a clear vision for an exceptional customer experience, is adept at simplifying the complex and collaborating across a highly matrixed organization. Key Qualifications 5+ years digital merchandising or equivalent experience Validated analytical and numerical aptitude; versed in Adobe analytics and proficient in analyzing data for decision making Experience with merchandising tools High attention to detail and obsesses over customer experience Experience working closely with creative and UX teams to build customer experiences and define shopping journeys. Proven ability to influence across teams to drive innovation and results Experience presenting to and influencing senior leadership Deep knowledge of the global retail industry and digital commerce trends Demonstrated ability to achieve strategic goals in an innovative and fast-paced environment. Superior verbal and written communications skills Excellent project management skills, including work prioritization and planning Ability to think and react in a high-energy, fast-paced environment Exceptional ability to problem solve, develop creative solutions, and demonstrate resourcefulness Experience with merchandising financing programs a plus Description Working closely with cross-functional team members, this role will be accountable for creating holistic merchandising briefs, strategies and forward looking merchandising roadmaps for all commercial programs in the Americas, as well as being merchandising lead on global level programs and promotions. Responsibilities Include: Author detailed merchandising briefs incorporating input from cross functional Retail partners including conversion analytics, Market Development, Product Management, Digital Content Management, Retail Marketing and Regional leads, as well as Retail leadership and Product Marketing teams. Briefs will support initiatives including: program launches, promotions, optimizations, new product introductions and geo-expansion projects. Gather data analysis/insights from various sources including but not limited to: sales data, site engagement metrics, customer chat and survey data, to inform discussions and the development of business optimizations and merchandising briefs. Attend creative design reviews and provide feedback on merchandising asset designs and content, ensuring they are achieving the requirements of the brief. Identify optimization and A/B testing opportunities to enhance merchandising messaging of commercial programs and promotional campaigns. Manage commercial programs plan of record, ensuring consistency of messaging across the customer journey and pages, and planning for optimizations as needed. Participate in validation of content in staging reviews in order to execute detailed plans. Develop business briefs for new merchandising capability and functionality requirements for capital projects in partnership with Product Management teams. Education & Experience BA/BS preferred, MBA a plus Additional Requirements Regular meetings with peers in Asia and Europe during overlapping business hours. Flexibility for occasional evening or weekend work during critical time periods. Join a worldwide company that welcomes the whole wide world. Our customers are all over the world, so it’s by design that Apple employees are all over the world, too. And we know our ability to continue creating the world’s most innovative products depends on people who represent the variety of the human experience and who inspire us with great thinking. Because the broader the backgrounds and perspectives, the bigger the ideas. At Apple, we’re not all the same. And that’s our greatest strength. At Apple, we’re not all the same. And that’s our greatest strength. We draw on the differences in who we are, what we’ve experienced, and how we think. Because to create products that serve everyone, we believe in including everyone. Role Number: 200390223

Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. The people here at Apple don’t just craft products - they build the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. The Digital Product Ops team (in AppleCare Digital) empowers customers to tackle problems themselves with innovative tools, digital content, and video; we also connect customers to assisted support channels like the Genius Bar and Call/Chat specialists. We live at the intersection of technology and the arts which means we create experiences that seamlessly help customers use and love their Apple products. The team creates and implements scalable and efficient processes so that the customer experience can be adapted to evolving customer needs. This position can sit onsite in our Austin, TX. or Cupertino, CA. campus. Key Qualifications Partnership and collaboration: Establishes strong working relationships with peers and partners to influence changes inside and outside of the team. Data Analysis: Uses data to analyze problems and influence outcomes; working knowledge of Tableau, Numbers, and Keynote is a plus. Digital expertise: Deep understanding of customer expectations for digital experiences. Experience using web and iOS app features. Customer focus: Experience communicating and building customer-focused experiences and asking questions to learn what’s possible. Business process improvement: Experience optimizing complex processes and improving team efficiency. Dedication to excellence: Driving efficiency while maintaining a high quality standard. Problem solving skills: Using data and empirical information to make decisions and drive consensus in a timely manner. Organization and project management: Ability to focus and simplify when juggling multiple projects and partners. Description The Digital Operations Program Manager is responsible for applying customer-facing digital applications to drive customer success across Apple’s most impactful customer journeys. We are looking for a curious and highly motivated individual who loves creating amazing user experiences, optimizing processes and driving impact. This position encompasses data analysis, customer focus, and innovation. You are comfortable zooming out to see the big picture and zooming in on details that matter, so they can optimize processes that transform customer and business problems into concrete solutions. Collaborate with and influence strategy teams, product managers, designers, writers and engineers to create the best possible customer experience on the Apple Support App and our Apple Support Website. Depending on the project, you will use your own expertise or delegate to other team members. You will need to quickly assess urgency, resource needs and team bandwidth in to increase project throughput. You will inspire, convey vision, outline requirements and prioritize work based on customer impact and identify critical success KPI’s in order to keep the team focused on what is most important. Education & Experience 5+ years of related experience with a Bachelor's degree, or 3+ years and a Master's degree Role Number: 200428594

Summary Digital sculptors on the Apple Industrial Design Team take projects from concept models to final production surfaces and are responsible for the production data sets. We are a group of imaginative, problem solving, creative people always looking to hone the craft of sculpting. We work hand in hand with Industrial Designers and partner closely with engineers, artists, model makers and vendors. A culture of technical excellence, learning and growth is fostered by a diverse and close knit team that has fun working side by side with the designers in the Apple Design Team. The sculpting team is crucial to the design and development of all current and future Apple products. Key Qualifications A strong passion and enthusiasm for pursuing a lasting career in the craft of 3D modeling. Proficiency in NURBS modeling is preferred (i.e. Alias, Rhino, etc.), as is the ability to go beyond the limitations of software tools and manually manipulate or refine surfaces. An understanding of solid modeling CAD programs is a plus. Candidates must enjoy working at a fast pace and possess perseverance, excellent problem solving, organization, and interpersonal skills. Experience in industrial design, digital design, model making, product design, or related field is desired; however, recent graduates with advanced surface modeling skills will also be considered. Any level modeler is encouraged to apply. Description The CAD sculptor creates high-quality digital 3D surface models used in the industrial design and product development process. Responsibilities include interpreting and defining the design intent of the industrial designer using Autodesk Alias software, while directly collaborating with mechanical engineering, packaging, and tooling teams. 3D data is used to develop numerous product concepts, detailed appearance models, high-quality renderings, and production level surfaces used in tooling for manufacturing. Education & Experience Our team includes people with various backgrounds including: Industrial Design, Transportation Design, Computer Graphics, 3D Animation/Modeling, Architecture, Fine Arts and Engineering from all over the world. Additional Requirements Please submit resume and portfolio in PDF format, emphasizing 3D modeling ability to digitalsculptor@apple.com Role Number: 200100523

Summary Apple is seeking an outgoing and enthusiastic dimensional engineer to join the Special Projects Group. The successful candidate will take a lead role in defining the dimensional strategy for the product to ensure industry-leading fit and finish as well as function. This engineer will bring cross-functional teams together and use GD&T fundamentals to deliver optimized solutions that meet the product build objectives. To be effective in this role, this person will need to collaborate successfully with both internal and external stakeholders. If you're passionate about precision, have a deep understanding of GD&T, have a working knowledge of diverse mass-production manufacturing technologies, and a data-driven approach to problem solving, this role is for you. Key Qualifications 5+ years in a dimensional engineering related role in a mass production industry In-depth knowledge of GD&T and ASME Y14.5-2009 Proficiency in 1D and 3D dimensional variation analysis Proficiency in VisVSA and/or 3DCS preferred Knowledge of measurement systems and manufacturing processes Knowledge of basic statistical concepts and process control Excellent written and verbal communication skills combined with the ability to clearly and accurately explain technical issues Experience in managing multiple development programs with internal engineering groups and external technology development partners and vendors Description In this role you’ll be responsible for defining and documenting datum and locator schemes at the part and sub-assembly level, running both 1D and 3D tolerance stacks, using statistical data to make design improvement recommendations, and tracking implementation of these recommendations into the designs to ensure the product conforms to the build objectives. You will also be responsible for working with the manufacturing and assembly teams to ensure that not only is the design optimized, but also the method of manufacture and assembly align with the design requirements. You will work with the quality organization to align and agree on check gauges and measurement techniques. As part of the role, you’ll help to define the tools and methods used to generate the statistical data needed to influence and improve the design. You will be responsible for defining drawing standards and ensuring consistency in how GD&T is used within all teams across the product. You will be responsible for evaluating measurement data, and based on this data, make recommendations to the manufacturing team on which changes to make to best meet the build objectives. Education & Experience Bachelor’s or Master’s in Mechanical Engineering or applicable fields Additional Requirements Expect to travel to external vendors, suppliers, and production line facilities. This is a role in Product Design. Although travel is expected, it is at reasonable frequency. Role Number: 200233527

Summary Do something different! Apple is looking for an elite engineer who can help identify, incubate, and deliver new display technologies. You will work with internal teams at Apple and external suppliers to craft the display related technologies that go into Apple products. The successful candidate will not only need to become comfortable with new technology but also be able to educate a broad audience of people at Apple about their benefits and tradeoffs. This position is focusing on the identification, prototyping, and communication of display technologies for future Apple products. The team features a diverse engineering roster including optical engineers, human perception experts, product design engineers, and experimental physicists. We work at a fast pace and require everyone to be highly self-motivated. A successful candidate needs to be a flexible thinker, fast learner and be able to problem solve outside of their respective technical areas. Key Qualifications Strong command of fundamentals in 2-3 of the following: optics, physics, materials science, electrical or mechanical engineering Broad engineering background encompassing displays, optoelectronics, imaging, and/or semiconductor devices Working knowledge of optical metrology, instrumentation, defect identification, and failure analysis techniques Proficiency using programing languages (MATLAB, or Mathematica, etc) and statistic tools (JMP, etc) to tackle practical engineering problems Experience working closely with multi-functional teams in a fast-paced environment Strong analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving skills Good project management, written and verbal communication skills Description - Explore, identify and validate new display technologies - Build compelling prototypes that demonstrate the new technologies - Collaborate with multi-functional teams including Backplane, Process, Optics, EE, Module and Product Design - Quantitatively and qualitatively assess benefits and trade-offs to user experience - Effectively communicate the advantages, disadvantage, and risks to key stake-holders - Shepherd the technology into both external supplier and internal product roadmaps Education & Experience M.S. or Ph.D. in Optical Science, EE, Physics or equivalent with 2+ years of experience in related field Additional Requirements Preferred Qualifications - Experience in high volume manufacturing of optoelectronic, display products, lens or imaging systems - In-depth technical knowledge of optics, display, or related technology manufacturing process (TFT, OLED, LED, LC, etc.) - Experience with new technology development and transfer to mass production - Design of experiments, FMEA, design for manufacture, reliability and failure analysis - Experience managing domestic and international vendors - Able to travel domestically and/or internationally Role Number: 200433192

Summary At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. We want outstanding engineers to bring passion and dedication to our team. Apple’s Display Technologies group is looking for Mechanical Engineers to design and develop innovative display modules for future products. Here you will create next-generation technologies, processes, and components, and own the integration of them into groundbreaking, mechanically robust display designs with amazing performance. Key Qualifications High energy personality with a real passion for learning and attention to detail Excellent prioritization, cross-functional collaboration, and written & verbal communication. Solid understanding of mechanical engineering fundamentals including properties of materials, solid mechanics, beam statics, Newtonian physics, and thermodynamics. The ability to perform mechanical design & validation, including the development of component or material evaluation tests, and failure analysis. 3D/2D software expertise: 3D modeling (Pro/E, NX, CATIA, or Solidworks), engineering drawings, Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T). Exposure to diverse manufacturing techniques such as injection-molding, sheet-metal stamping, 3D printing, and materials such as polymers, glass, and metals. Good understanding of DFA/DFM, and statistical tolerance analysis. Applied Design of Experiments (DOE) and scientific method to address engineering issues. Willingness and ability to travel internationally (~15%, primarily Asia). Description Our team wants colleagues with a strong curiosity and understanding of the design and development of consumer electronics or mechanical design fields. • Investigate state-of-the-art mechanical designs and technologies, innovate ways to further improve Apple display performance, and enable strong and compact system designs. • Define the module mechanical architecture based on optical, electrical, mechanical, and other cross-functional requirements. Work with the system team to define the interface to the product including fit, assembly features, and tolerance analyses. Deliver any needed specifications including 3D/2D. • Achieve system goals through mechanical design optimization, prototyping, new material qualification, and manufacturing processes. Audit factories to review the manufacturing and assembly at each step to ensure high yield and high quality. • Define & implement validation plans for ME characteristics of the display modules using scientific & analytical approaches. Drive thorough failure analyses for any issues to reach robust corrective actions. Ensure the specifications are met throughout the supply chain. Communicate validation results to peers and leadership. • Act as a focal point among multiple world-class cross-functional teams and suppliers to identify open issues, drive them to closure, and deliver mechanically robust displays. Support the product throughout the architecture, engineering development, mass-production ramp-up, and launch. Education & Experience BS or MS with up to two years in Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering. Additional Requirements Preferred qualifications • Experience with simulation and analysis such as Finite Element Analysis (FEA) for structural and thermal, Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD). • Familiarity with Six Sigma methodology, process capability, and capable of large data set analysis using JMP, MATLAB, or Minitab. • Electro-mechanical design and/or manufacturing for high-volume products with an emphasis on reliability. Role Number: 200441900

Summary Our team is on a mission to provide innovative infrastructure and tools to make engineers work easier and make software easier to create, build and distribute. We believe that streamlining software engineering is an important part of unlocking developer creativity and innovation, and we enjoy when Apple customers see that in the products we ship. We are looking for distributed systems engineers to join our efforts. You'll be developing novel distributed architectures, products and services for accelerating software build, test and deployment cycles. If you enjoy working on distributed systems, then we have many exciting problems to work on! We believe that every engineer brings unique skills and perspective. Far more than any specific experience or skill, we are looking for engineers who want to build great reliable software and services, learn and develop their skills, and ultimately enable others to develop amazing applications. You would join a small, tight-knit group of engineers who build exciting new technology, and have fun while doing so. Key Qualifications Positive and respectful attitude in a diverse environment. Strong interest in distributed systems, reliability, and cloud services. Ability to efficiently develop, debug and support new technologies in a changing environment. Excellent collaborative skills, with strong written and verbal communication. Description Our team works on evolving a set of innovative distributed backend services and tools. You’ll find ways to combine our unique problem domain with established distributed system techniques in order to achieve high performance, reliability and long term maintainability. You'll analyze problem requirements, existing solutions, and available systems and make high-level architectural decisions about how to architect the backend, considering both medium- and long-term goals. Once solutions are identified, you will work alongside our team to implement them while developing appropriate testing and operational mechanisms. You will be most successful here as a flexible and proactive engineer who thrives in a supportive, respectful, and balanced work environment with interesting and challenging problems to tackle. You have excellent judgement and integrity with the ability to make timely and sound decisions. You know how to drive constructive discussion of design points, learn from your team, and use your experience to advocate and teach others. In your role as an engineer on our team you will: • Spend a majority of your time working on distributed services engineering, tooling, and contributing to operational standards used across the organization. • Collaborate with your teammates to help refine problem requirements and work with teams to implement long lasting solutions. • Engage with other teams to help identify issues and establish long term relationships that include knowledge sharing. • Provide valuable feedback loops to engineering teams backed by application metrics and log data. • Drive areas of service scalability (resiliency, redundancy, performance) by collaborating in planning meetings. • Develop expertise and be given ownership over components critical to Apple’s success. • Contribute to engineering a high-performance system through algorithm design, optimization, and performance testing. • Design new ways to scale Apple’s distributed services to ever increasing problem sizes. • Analyze and improve the operability of our services and tools. • Have access to the engineers who create Apple’s full technology, tools, and operating systems stack. Here you’ll find that we: • Have a wide range of experience, from new engineers to Apple veterans. • Provide a relaxed work environment where you can choose when to socialize and when to dig into your projects. • Have an encouraging and growth-focused workplace culture. • Encourage you to use accrued vacation time and maintain a healthy work-life balance! • Offer excellent benefits. This position is based at Apple's campus in Cupertino, California. For qualifying candidates, relocation assistance will be included in the offer package. Education & Experience BS in Computer Science or related experience. Additional Requirements We welcome all applicants, but familiarity with the following areas will help you come up to speed fastest on our project: • Existing distributed databases and distributed computation engine systems. • Understanding of distributed systems’ space concerns and algorithms. • Familiar with application and service monitoring tools and techniques. • Involvement with incident management and response. • Familiarity with some large infrastructure systems like Kubernetes. • Experience with high performance strongly typed languages such as Swift, Rust, C++, Scala, or others. • Familiar with virtualization technology. Summary At Apple, phenomenal ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Summary Why Apple? At Apple we believe our products begin with our people. By hiring a diverse team we drive creative thought. By giving that team everything they need we drive innovation. By hiring incredible engineers we drive precision. And through our collaborative process we create memorable experiences for our customers. These elements come together to make Apple an amazing environment for motivated people to do the greatest work of their lives. You will become part of a hands-on development team that sets the standard in cultivating excellence, creativity and innovation. Will you help us design the next generation of revolutionary Apple products? Why SoftGoods? Apple’s SoftGoods Engineering team is relatively new to Apple. We work with textiles, leather, silicone and soft polymers. Our mission is to use these incredible materials to enable new product categories, and to enhance Apple’s existing product lines. Bringing Apple engineering and precision to products made of soft materials is an exciting challenge and requires a creative and open-minded approach. We have a talented team of people from a wide variety of backgrounds. We all work together in a beautiful customized lab where we design, engineer and develop the best softgoods products in the world. If this sounds like an exciting challenge, we hope you will consider a place in our team and encourage you to consider this role. Key Qualifications At least 5 years of project management experience related to developing computer accessories or related consumer products. Experience working closely with product design and other cross functional teams to drive closure of technical issues and communicate risk. Experience creating schedules, managing program finances, and tracking budget Experience fostering relationships with manufacturing suppliers and coordinating development builds You are someone who is analytical, professionally assertive, and exhibit excellent attention to detail Strong verbal & written communication and executive level presentation skills You exhibit a deeply curious mindset about new ideas Description What is the role? We are looking for an enthusiastic and highly motivated engineering project manager (EPM) with a proven consumer product development track record to work cross functionally with our Softgoods Product Design Team. In this role you will drive the day-to-day activities to meet the overall program objectives related to mechanical design, development, and engineering validation. You will enable team success by crafting and monitoring a streamlined development plan, managing critical path, and driving timely issue resolution. You will lead team meetings, document action items, drive followup, and be accountable for communicating development and schedule status to senior management. Your role will include coordinating with Product Design, Industrial Design (ID), Operations, Reliability and other key cross functional teams. You will understand technical issues and drive them to closure by bringing together key partners and facilitating problem solving and decision-making. You will be empowered to build great relationships across high-energy teams. You will work closely with manufacturing suppliers and OEM partners. The role will require up to 20% international travel to support manufacturing builds in Asia. Other skills and training we like to see: - Experience as a practicing mechanical engineer or related product development role prior to becoming a project manager - Experience working with industrial designers or other similarly creative product developers - Prior experience working with soft goods materials and processes (synthetics, leather, textiles) - Prior experience traveling internationally to work closely with manufacturing suppliers Education & Experience - BS ME or equivalent Pay & Benefits At Apple, your base pay is one part of your total compensation package. This role pays between $113,500 and $207,000, and your actual base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Apple employees also have the opportunity to own shares of Apple stock, because all Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, as well as a discount when purchasing Apple stock if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive other benefits: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits. Note: Apple benefits programs are subject to eligibility requirements. Role Number: 200443456

jobTitle: Global Contact Delivery Support Analyst - AMR
jobDescription: Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. The people here at Apple don’t just craft products - they build the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. As a Worldwide Contact Delivery Support Analyst (CDSA) you will become an expert in identifying and resolving issues impacting AppleCare Customers ability to connect with Advisors. CDSAs have a diverse range of responsibilities that allow our team to deliver a valuable support function to our global AppleCare contact centers. You will be responsible for partnering with various stakeholders to understand and drive service impacting issues to resolution. We are looking for a hardworking, independent person to join our team. This position can be based on-site in Austin, TX. Elk Grove, CA. Key Qualifications Leadership skills that demonstrate your ability to lead peers, peer groups and various management levels Demonstrated ability to build your own ideas and work to develop effective strategies to get results History of analyzing and interpreting real time and historical data to identify and execute strategies for issue resolution Ability to bring individuals together teams across SO&T, AppleCare Operations, IS&T, AC Contact Centers, WFM and others, to drive complex initiatives forward Proven ability to drive influential conversations with Business and Operations Leadership Detailed understanding of Contact Center metrics and how these metrics impact performance Ability to work independently and successfully navigate ambiguity Understanding of complex networks and the ability to troubleshoot and isolate issues Experience capturing and debugging network information (a plus) Willingness to be in the details of every aspect of Advisor and Platforms Support Description Keeping AppleCare’s worldwide contact centers running smoothly is at the forefront of what we do. A Global Contact Delivery Support Analyst needs to be a person that is willing to tackle any issue big or small that will help the Contact Center perform at its best. This person thrives in a fast-paced environment and is comfortable driving results through ambiguous situations. As a CDSA your schedule will need to be flexible to support WW Contact Centers based on the demands of the business. Additionally, CDSAs share an on-call schedule after normal business hours and on weekends and can expect to be on call every 2-3 weeks. A CDSA is passionate about finding issues and driving them to resolution. You will find issues by digging into dashboards of data, reporting tools and escalations raised by AC contact centers and our partners. Additionally, you will monitor real time and historical data to understand issues that are impacting Contact Center service levels, contact delivery and Advisor availability. The faster you can recognize and resolve the more rapidly we can improve the customer experience. As a CDSA you will need to collaborate optimally with our business partners, Contact Center leadership, Vendor Management, OSV leadership and IT teams, Program and Tool owners, Support Operations peer groups, IS&T, internal and partner WFM teams, amongst others to drive results. CDSAs host large daily operations and seasonal checkpoint calls with Contact Center leadership to discuss contact center performance and issues impacting our contact centers. Additionally, you will meet with Product Owners and our readiness teams, to review trending issues, upcoming changes, and tool roadmaps. CDSAs cultivate excellent working relationships with our many internal and external partners to find solutions to challenges in a dynamic environment. Education & Experience Bachelors degree or equivalent experience Role Number: 200438773

jobTitle: Global Partner Marketing Manager, Ad Platforms
jobDescription: Summary At Apple, we believe in the power of technology to enrich people's lives. Everything we build is designed — first and foremost — with helping people in mind. We believe digital advertising is no different, and that its value should come from how it benefits customers, not what it extracts from them. Our Ad Platforms team applies that belief to create ads that add value, by helping people discover content, supporting creators, and protecting and respecting everyone’s privacy. We help developers and marketers drive discovery of their apps across the App Store with Apple Search Ads. We help advertisers promote their products alongside trusted content in the brand-safe environment of Apple News, while supporting publishers and journalists. All with the same commitment to privacy you expect from Apple. Because when advertising is done right, it benefits everyone. We’re looking for an exceptional B2B marketer to improve and scale marketing through our global advertising partner program. Do you have a deep understanding of performance marketing and proven success cultivating mutually beneficial channel marketing partnerships that drive business growth? Are you a business-minded marketer with a knack for evaluating market opportunities and coming up with innovative partnership ideas, developing effective joint marketing plans, and providing expert marketing guidance to partners? If you care deeply about building marketing partnerships to help businesses grow, we want to talk with you! Knowledge across SMB and developer audiences is ideal. Direct experience working for or with advertising agencies or adtech companies is beneficial. Key Qualifications 10+ years experience leading B2B marketing initiatives and managing partner marketing relationships. Prior success building global partner marketing strategies and co-marketing plans, developing marketing content for partners, and ensuring alignment and consistent positioning in partner campaigns. Competency with crafting partner marketing agreements, establishing performance metrics, and analyzing results. Strong written and verbal communication — with ability to adapt for different audiences, facilitate discussion, and persuasively convey key messages. Skilled at developing collaborative relationships and managing expectations across internal and external teams. Self-starter who excels at connecting the dots between strategy and execution, balancing creative and analytical thinking, and leading through influence. Possess unquestionable personal code of ethics and integrity. Description Reporting to the Global Channel Marketing Lead, this person will drive our global partner marketing channel strategy and execution. Day-to-day, the Global Partner Marketing Manager will need to balance both strategic and tactical individual contribution with direct and indirect management and prioritization for a global team. They will: Evaluate and activate new marketing partnerships, lead strategic marketing planning with senior partner contacts, and oversee ongoing efforts to help partners market our advertising solutions. Bring focus and process improvements to deliver on ambitious program objectives and effectively collaborate across extended marketing, business, and legal teams inside and outside of Apple. Be an internal advocate for partners — guiding content strategy and asset development to support partners, highlighting collaboration opportunities, and reporting on the impact of partner marketing efforts. Be a subject matter expert on our advertising solutions — encouraging partners to execute marketing campaigns that promote our joint value proposition and evaluating co-marketing opportunities. Education & Experience BA/BS in Marketing, Communications, Business Administration, Journalism, or related field. MBA desirable. Additional Requirements Some travel required. Pay & Benefits At Apple, your base pay is one part of your total compensation package. This role pays between $139,000 and $261,000, and your actual base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Apple employees also have the opportunity to own shares of Apple stock, because all Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, as well as a discount when purchasing Apple stock if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive other benefits: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits. Note: Apple benefits programs are subject to eligibility requirements. Role Number: 200407896

jobTitle: Global Supplier Program Manager, Worldwide Logistics
jobDescription: Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. The people here at Apple don’t just build products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that encourages the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple and help us leave the world better than we found it. This role is part of the Worldwide Logistics Procurement Team reporting into the WW Logistics Procurement Manager. This is a fast moving & dynamic environment where flexibility & adaptability are key attributes needed for success. As a WW Logistics Global Supplier Program Manager, you will be responsible for the management of the commercial framework for Apple’s global distribution centre supplier network for both forward and reverse logistics services. The role has responsibility for establishing the structures to measure, compare and validate (audit) the cost effectiveness of the distribution centres globally and implementing an activity based ‘should cost’ model that is data driven and comparable across all geographies. The role works cross functionally with Apple Logistics operations, Finance, BPR, IST and Legal to put defined processes in place to measure the performance from a cost effectiveness perspective of the sites against the contractual commitments and pricing terms. Key Qualifications • Program management skills to standardize & implement processes across all sites in all regions and across all Suppliers • Deep knowledge of the key cost drivers within an outsourced Distribution Centre operation and understanding the commercial impacts of economic and competitor landscape. • Ability to leverage Market intelligence to develop and build Logistics commodity and industry knowledge to support and influence long-term strategy that meets future needs of Apple. • Data management & system capabilities: ability to implement analytic tools at an activity based level to model, compare and validate operating costs within an outsourced service provider • Champion Social & Environmental projects across the network. • RFQ (Request for Quotation) procurement management skills • Professional Procurement experience • Ability to think strategically and develop long term road maps to maximize opportunities • Skilled at networking through a complex organization to develop relationships with internal customers to identify and get cost savings programs • Clear communication style to work with Suppliers, internal customers/partners and executive management to drive logistics strategies • Willingness to travel Description Typical responsibilities will include but not be limited to: • Development of strategies to ensure that distribution center costs are optimal and identifying best of breed comparative value analysis • Define, document and data management of the key cost components that can drive an activity based pricing approach • ‘Activity based pricing’ management • ‘Should cost’ management of all key data inputs that drive a distribution centre network • Auditing capabilities managing statical analysis of findings and driving improvement through change management • Development of strategies to ensure that distribution center costs are optimal and identifying best of breed comparative value analysis • Responsible for negotiating supplier contracts and the financial analysis associated with driving an agreement that supports Apple’s objectives. • Management of Apple Supplier Responsibility, Apple Environmental and Social responsibility compliance programs. • Development of others to build domain knowledge expertise and groom future leaders for procurement. • Responsible for review of all business documents being released to the suppliers: RFPs, RFIs, Statement of Work (SOW), Master Agreements (MSAs), and formal communications. Working closely with Legal and the Manager of WW Logistics procurement • Ensure that procurement efforts are accomplished on time to meet the business schedules. • Ensures NDA, SOW's and Master Contracts are positioned appropriately before business is initiated. • Works closely with and provides critical issue support for RSM when performance (supplier or Apple) impacts contractual agreements, i.e. theft/loss claims, inventory discrepancies, SLA non-compliance. • Industry knowledge to conduct benchmarking exercises to assess competitiveness of Apple’s rates and identify any potential future partners • Drive continual cost reduction and avoidance initiatives through ad hoc price negotiations, surcharge and accessorial avoidance in compliance with Logistics Procurement Policies. Education & Experience Bachelors Degree in Business, Engineering, or related fields. MBA preferred Additional Requirements 5 years business industry experience with hands on experiences of finance assessment and auditing, Supplier management. Role Number: 200394587

Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Apple is seeking a Global Sourcing & Supply Manager (GSSM) to assist with Silicon Strategic Planning, long-term deal structuring and negotiations. This position requires working with procurement, engineering, finance and legal teams and also third-parties such as semiconductor foundries and suppliers. This position requires strong quantitative and analytical skills, critical thinking, and ability to balance multiple projects simultaneously. Key Qualifications The Global Sourcing & Supply Manager is positioned at the interface between Apple’s product teams and the industries that supply core component technologies. We are responsible for developing and carrying out sourcing strategies as well as recommending product innovations based on improving technology. The position requires an interest in market dynamics, pricing, manufacturing processes, and risk mitigation. The team drives centralized capacity planning for all semiconductor components used across Apple products and helps drive long term strategic deals. Description The role is complex and often has to wear multiple hats: focusing on big picture roadmap one moment and the minute details the next. Here are some highlights of the role: - Develop a multifaceted understanding of the semiconductor commodity landscape to forecast industry trends and gauge emerging forces. Identify changes in buyer and supplier power and use industry dynamics to Apple’s advantage. - Perform supplier financial research, spend analysis and ad-hoc financial analysis for strategic procurement deals - Work with suppliers to negotiate optimal terms for sourcing. Understand the trade-offs between cost, volume, and quality in order to strike agreements that meet Apple’s performance criteria and secure long-term supply continuity. - Collaborate across the Apple organization to ensure business objectives are met. Includes rapidly synthesizing and presenting findings to senior leaders and to actively identify potential supply issues that can affect product strategy. - Optimize silicon supply chain performance through cost and capacity scenario analysis, and benchmarking. Develop an in-depth understanding of valued manufacturing processes and costs and market intelligence, and apply this knowledge to influence Apple’s future product roadmap and sourcing decisions. - Provide overall program management support and supply to ongoing development of processes, templates, issue procedures, and reporting Education & Experience BA/BS degree plus 3 to 5 years of work experience, masters degree or MBA is a plus Additional Requirements Experience in semiconductor supply chain operations or semiconductor equity research is desired Direct experience in long-term silicon capacity planning, a plus Strong analytical and critical thinking Ability to develop sound internal and external working relationships An interest with negotiation Ability to make quick decisions with 80% information Thirst for knowledge and the ability to learn quickly - Willingness to travel internationally (20% - 30%) Role Number: 200380940

Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. jobDescription: Summary Imagine what you could do here. The people here at Apple don’t just build products — they craft the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. As Global Supply Manager - Renewable Energy Transactions and Investments you will partner with the Environment & Supply Chain Innovation, and Global Energy & Sustainability, and Finance teams to procure low-cost environmental attributes using innovative transactions and investments which profitably achieve Apple’s environmental objectives. Key Qualifications Lead the origination, structuring, due diligence, negotiation and execution of transactions and investments to ensure Apple business and environmental objectives are met Develop a multifaceted understanding of the key barriers facing global commodity renewable energy markets and forecast industry trends, identifying changes in buyer and seller market power to use for Apple’s advantage Develop financial models of energy transactions and investments demonstrating extraordinary quantitative ability and ownership of key assumptions, accounting and valuation methodologies Demonstrate quantitative and communication style to clearly communicate varying risk reward between transaction options and help drive leadership decision making Perform supplier financial research, spend analysis and ad-hoc financial analysis for strategic renewable energy procurement for Apple and its suppliers Coordinate with Environmental Supply Chain Innovation, Global Energy and Sustainability with other environmental, operations, procurement, finance, government affairs and legal teams to champion, drive, and coordinate renewable energy transactions Description Comfort with independently closing complex energy transactions and/or investments Quantitative modeling capability, familiarity with key assumptions, inputs and outputs of discounted cash flow analysis of infrastructure project financings Experience structuring and closing complex energy transactions involving overlapping financial engineering, technical innovation, and evolving regulatory compliance requirements in global markets, including Asia and the US Excellent project management experience; excels at building internal and external relationships Proven success influencing and driving alignment across cross-functional teams, resolving organization barriers to success and building consensus during the project lifecycle Excellent verbal and visual communication ability, clearly communicate technical information in a concise way to a non-technical audience Proven strategic and tactical abilities, able to influence colleagues and improvise to address challenging macroeconomic market conditions Quantitative ability to model project financed infrastructure investments using discounted cash flow and other valuation techniques Appetite for knowledge and ability to learn quickly Education & Experience B.S. degree in related field. Summary Global Supply Managers (GSMs) in supplier diversity engage within all areas of Apple. We participate in the commercial relationships, strategic deals, cost negotiations, help ensure continuity of supply and risk management to drive operational and cost efficiencies through process or design change. GSMs sit at the intersection of Apple's business activities and procurement communities, and effectively balance the needs of both groups to ensure successful product launches and the best utilization of the top available diverse suppliers. GSMs in Supplier Diversity are the face of Apple’s globally recognized supplier diversity. Launched in 1993, the Global Supplier Diversity team helps qualified certified diverse- owned companies do business with Apple. Our vision is to use the power and scale of our platforms and services to transform the way diverse suppliers connect to customers, each other, and to the tools and resources to grow! Key Qualifications • 5+ years of experience in supply chain development and sourcing • Top-notch analytical/negotiation skills • Ability to toggle between strategic and detail orientated thinking • Proven analytical and problem-solving skills to resolve issues strategically • Excellent communication skills, • Demonstrated capability of working in multinational environments, driven and motivated by accomplishing extraordinary objectives • Knowledge of legal, financial and technology components of Strategic Sourcing • Experience breaking down cost models and identifying key drivers • Experience building successful relationships with business partners, cross- functional groups, and vendors to drive accountability and optimizing performance • Experience in inspiring change and improving end-to-end processes • Experience flourishing in an environment of fast growth and ambiguity • Strong proficiency in Excel, Keynote, Pages, Numbers, etc. • Ability to travel domestically and internationally 25% Description Successful GSMs thrive in a rapidly changing environment and constantly drive excellence across their own responsibilities as well as that of team members and partners. They frequently leverage strategic internal relationships to effectively collaborate with procurement, engineering, operations and other cross functional teams. We have to make smart decisions with sometimes limited information, stay focused under pressure, and communicate concisely and effectively with senior management. GSMs identify and scale new and existing supplier partners as well as executing creative and strategic commercial deals to achieve Apple goals around cost, supply, quality and diversity and inclusion. This is a unique opportunity for a professional with a passion for creating economic opportunity to work with a wide variety of internal teams and directly contribute to achieving this important and high-profile goal! Responsibilities: • Develop and implement strategies to support business stakeholders in achieving diverse supplier spend goals with a data informed, sourcing supported approach • Identify, develop, and deploy industry-leading supplier management, procurement, and category management practices • Maintain current and comprehensive knowledge of best-in-class diverse suppliers that will be project-competitive in key categories • Lead end-to-end Sourcing projects (including planning, execution, measurement, and optimization of projects). Actively identify and track any issues and risks for the projects • Lead the contract negotiation process with internal partners and suppliers • RFx Services: Own the interface and lead engagement with suppliers for all RFI, RFP, and RFQ activities • Present RFx results and bid leveling, lead the evaluation process of bid award with evaluation team, and drive the closure of a Sourcing decision. Officially close the process with all recognized bidders • Establish strong collaborative relationships with Global Supply Managers, OPD, Manufacturing & Design, Logistics, Procurement Business Operations, Supplier Responsibility, Environmental and Social Initiatives, Government Affairs, Inclusion and Diversity, Sales and Strategic Deals. Education & Experience • Bachelor's degree in Business, Supply Chain, Finance, Management or related field. MBA preferred Role Number: 200359377

Summary Apple is a place where extraordinary people come together to do their life’s best work. Our people don’t just create products—they create wonder, and transform the possibilities of technology. If you’re excited by the idea of supporting a team that has a real impact on the world, a career with Apple may be your dream job. Are you excited about graphics programming and passionate about UI? Would you like to use your rendering and UI expertise to build beautiful, high performance Watch Faces that push the limit of what a watch can do? Join the team that is revolutionizing the watch! As a graphics engineer on the Apple Watch team, you will be one of the experts responsible for building sophisticated Watch Faces with both high and low level frameworks. You’ll work closely with the UI design, iOS Frameworks, and QA teams to develop interactions of quality that will ship to millions of users. You will join a hands-on development team that fosters creativity and generates novel solutions to deliver engineering excellence. Key Qualifications Experience with graphics APIs (Metal, OpenGL, Direct3D, Console, etc.) Experience with Shader Languages (HLSL/GLSL, Metal Shaders) and writing custom shaders Strong Objective-C and/or Swift coding ability Experience with Apple UI frameworks (UIKit, CoreAnimation, SwiftUI) and an eye for UI detail Excellent communication and social skills Description As a member of the team you will have many responsibilities relating to the design, development, and testing of the device software. These include: - We collaborate closely with the design team to open up the boundaries on human-computer interactions. - We craft solutions tailored to the constraints of the software and the hardware of a small, low power device. - We work closely with the iOS Apps, iOS Frameworks and Hardware teams to craft robust and maintainable systems that will stand the test of time. - We coordinate with the quality assurance teams to ensure full test coverage as well as to initiate focused testing on critical components. Education & Experience - BS CE/CS or equivalent experience required. Role Number: 200440795

Summary Apple's Technology Development Group works with advanced technologies, including the augmented reality (AR) platform ARKit and Metal 2, to create ground-breaking new products. Do you want to push the limits of the best Augmented Reality platform in the world? Would you like to help craft Augmented Reality experiences for millions of people? In this position, you will have the opportunity to partner with our extraordinary team of technologists, artists and designers to build new software products that will change the way people experience their own reality! Key Qualifications 2+ years of industry experience (although strong recent college graduates will be considered) in the following areas: Experience with at least one of the current graphics APIs (Metal, Direct3D 12, Vulkan, etc...) Knowledge of modern rendering techniques Knowledge of C/C++ or Swift Knowledge of 3D math Some understanding of GPU architecture Description Your main responsibilities will be to: - Develop frameworks and tools - Work with designers and creatives to drive new features - Work with various teams at Apple to integrate advanced technologies If you like challenges and are passionate about the AR/VR space, then this is the place for you. Education & Experience BS/MS in CS or comparable degree or relevant experience Additional Requirements Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. jobTitle: Group Design Lead, Creative Services & Production
jobDescription: Summary At Apple, we’re not all the same. And that’s our greatest strength. We draw on the differences in who we are, what we’ve experienced, and how we think. Because to create products that serve everyone, we believe in including everyone. The Creative Services & Production group is responsible for the creation, ideation, production and execution of experiential, events and editorial video content for Apple Services. We are seeking a hardworking individual who can contribute in a team environment and wants to be part of a growing organization. This position requires a proactive, highly collaborative individual with strong communication creative and design skills. As the Group Design Lead in our Design Studio, you will be responsible for crafting innovative and compelling design solutions and executing multiple design studies for events and experiences. This requires broad experience in developing creative solutions in a variety of mediums. As a hardworking member of the team, you will thrive in a fast-moving environment with a collaborative spirit. Individuals are encouraged to bring all of their strengths and talents, and to shine as a part of our team. Key Qualifications 15+ years experience in the line of work including being directly accountable for and managing a team to deliver on the creative deliverables across an experience , event, content piece, etc. You have a strong grasp of the creative development process, have excellent creative direction skills, and consistently deliver excellent design. You have a deep knowledge for - and avid consumption of - design, entertainment, music, culture, content, social media, live events and experiences, trends and innovation, with the ability to apply this insight to the creation of events and experiences You have in-depth knowledge of all steps required in the creative process, including effectively and efficiently staffing projects, providing communication and creative direction, and giving timely and helpful feedback to improve creative solutions. Your design skills are outstanding, and you have the ability to guide, evaluate, and if necessary, redirect creative development. You have extraordinary attention to detail, while still working under tight deadlines You have experience handling multiple, concurrent projects with a collaborative approach You have strong written and verbal communication skills to external and internal audiences and customers and the ability to distill communication into actionable plans Description Respond the creative briefs with innovative and inspiring ideas and designs Lead a cross functional team of experiential designers to translate strategic creative direction into high-quality designs. Partner with strategy leads to ensure designs meet business objectives Ensure assets are delivered within budget and on time. Produce fresh, innovative work that translates complex ideas into compelling designs for sophisticated audiences. Education & Experience Bachelors degree or equivalent required Additional Requirements Proficient in Keynote, and Adobe Creative Suite Motion Design (After Effects, etc.) and 3D (Cinema 4D, Blender, etc.) knowledge Role Number: 200333468

Summary Hardware Validation Engineering team is seeking a hardware validation engineer. Description - Working with test framework and tools to create a controlled validation environment to support large scale validation - Generating test cases and execute test on hardware configurations based on coverage analysis - Setting up and maintaining physical test environment and used in validation testing. - Debugging cross functionally with software, hardware and silicon design teams. - Tracking, analyzing and reporting of critical test data. - Creating software checks to compare observed behavior against expected behavior that is derived from system specifications. - Designing and defining new validation strategy and detailed test plans. Description - Working with test framework and tools to create a controlled validation environment to support large scale validation - Generating test cases and execute test on hardware configurations based on coverage analysis - Setting up and maintaining physical test environment and used in validation testing. - Debugging cross functionally with software, hardware and silicon design teams. - Tracking, analyzing and reporting of critical test data. - Creating software checks to compare observed behavior against expected behavior that is derived from system specifications. - Designing and defining new validation strategy and detailed test plans. jobDescription: Summary Apple is looking for a Jr Camera HW & SW Prototyping Engineer to join a fast growing production tools development team. We’re looking for an enthusiastic and self starting Engineer to advance the development of cutting edge technology for use in high-end professional production environments. The Engineer will support the Senior Camera HW & SW Prototyping Engineer to develop and execute the strategies and designs agreed on with internal teams and/or external partners & vendors. The systems this team creates will be used in high stakes production environments where there’s only one chance to capture amazing content. This team embraces a scrappy, “fail fast & often,” and “if a solution already exists, we’ll buy it” approach to production tools R&D. The Engineer will be virtually unbound to explore any and all technologies in order to bring to life new tools for production stakeholders asking for the impossible. If developing bleeding edge, high-availability, professional capture tools at the intersection of art and technology is your passion, this could be the opportunity you’ve been working towards. Key Qualifications 5+ years experience leading or contributing to the development of the technology to support professional or high reliability AR/XR/3D or 2D capture systems. Experience working with professional camera systems (Sony, ARRI, IMAX, RED, etc.). Hands-on experience implementing HW designs and programming with FPGA devices. (Xilinx, Vivido, etc.) Experience delivering mechanical and/or industrial design CAD models from PoC to FATP using Solidworks, Inventor, NX, etc. Experience designing multilayer PCB’s employing data protocols like UART, SPI, I2C using Allegro, Altium, Eagle, etc. Experience programming in C/C++ & scripting languages like Perl/Python. Knowledge of image processing using OpenCV. Deep knowledge of low voltage DC-DC power systems and noise suppression and filtering techniques. Experience controlling and implementing high repeatability servos, geared motor and drivers. Experience working in theatrical or live production environments. Description The Jr Camera HW & SW Prototyping Engineers “normal day at the office” will include researching, presenting and negotiating technical approaches with cross functional stakeholders, then developing the CAD models and EE schematics for those ideas to be manufactured using Apples world class rapid prototyping and manufacturing capabilities. The Engineer will work with production engineering and maintenance staff to test and validate prototypes and production units in real world scenarios. In addition to working on new designs, the Engineer will be the point person for running root cause analysis and troubleshooting issues production crews discover in the field. Additional Requirements - Prior experience working with and designing for non-standard types of photography or cinematography such as underwater, aerial, extreme conditions, and virtual production. - Familiarity with typical video and audio recording formats commonly found in the cinematic or live broadcast industry. (RAW, ProRes, EXR, BWF, etc.) - Familiarity with video transport protocols like SMPTE-2110 or SDI. - Familiarity with production equipment and maintenance tasks typically found in cinematic or live broadcast environments. - Able to read and draw wiring harness and pinout schematics. - Able to solider IC’s and other small components, by hand. - Working knowledge of media production and workflow tools such as Adobe Premiere, BlackMagic Resolve, ColorFront (OSD), ShotGrid/ShotGun, Perforce, Unity, Unreal, etc. - Experience using standard organization and communication tools. Summary Apple is seeking a Manufacturing Engineer to join the Advanced Manufacturing Engineering team. As a member of our team, you will lead the development of manufacturing processes, create prototypes to validate product designs, and manage vendors in the selection of best manufacturing technologies to deliver target performance and cost. You will participate in all stages of product development, collaborating with product design teams, ultimately delivering validated product designs in volume production. Key Qualifications 5+ years of experience in new product manufacturing process development and deployment in mass production. Expertise in battery pack assembly and manufacturing process development, including adhesive dispense, battery cell handling, and laser welding. Experience coordinating design for manufacturing activities and negotiating conflicting requirements with parts vendors and product design teams. Proven history of managing contract manufacturers during manufacturing process and equipment definition, design, and qualification. Experience developing automated manufacturing equipment and managing equipment vendors from design through final acceptance. Experience in high and low volume manufacturing environments, including transitioning products from prototype to mass production, and introducing new processes to existing mass production systems. Experience designing mechanical equipment, fixtures, and tooling in CAD (NX preferred). Expertise in production quality metrics, GD&T, and process/equipment qualification procedures. Ability to work in a dynamic environment, with limited technical information, and "wear multiple hats" as needed. Great written, verbal, and presentation skills with the ability to communicate well with management, peers, and suppliers. Description You will be responsible for developing manufacturing processes and define critical process parameters to guarantee product performance and quality in prototyping and in mass production. You will work with product design engineers, providing critical DFx feedback and helping define manufacturing strategies for new products. You will manage the development of battery pack prototyping systems as needed to validate product design and manufacturing processes. You will create detailed work instructions and train technicians on new equipment operation. You will create manufacturing recipes during product prototyping phases and guarantee proper transfer of new processes to mass production. You will create equipment specifications, manage system integrators during quoting and design phases, and provide hands-on support during startup, installation, and commissioning of new equipment. You will also manage contract manufacturers during their equipment development and process validation to assure product quality, yields, and throughput targets are achieved. In addition to your technical skills, you will sustain highly interactive relationships with internal teams and external vendors managing tradeoffs between product performance and manufacturability, and guiding suppliers to realize our designs in production. Education & Experience BS in Manufacturing, Mechanical, or Electrical Engineering required, MS or PhD highly preferred. Additional Requirements Travel to vendors, suppliers, and production facilities will be required. Projects are cyclical with initial development in local prototype labs, eventually transitioning to mass manufacturing sites during which travel can be upwards of 25%. Role Number: 200350000
