Summary At Apple, our products, services, and customer experiences demand extraordinary innovation. Technology and environmental breakthroughs are crucial in the materials and processes we bring to high volume production to lead the world in terms of carbon and material performance. Can you imagine your talents supporting Apple’s next leap ahead? We are establishing a new team of Materials specialists with a key focus on bringing deep materials understanding in to the core product design process. We need you! Are you passionate about materials and being part of an extraordinary engineering team? Do you want to work with multi-functional initiatives with outstanding suppliers and institutes delivering first of a kind material developments? Do you adopt ownership and accountability? Do you want to work hand-in-hand with phenomenal people across Electrical Engineering, Product Design, Reliability Engineering in Apple’s key Product teams? If yes, we want you to join our diverse and impactful team! Key Qualifications Deep understanding of thermal, mechanical, electrical test methodologies Attention to detail and a strong passion for quality Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with multi-functional teams about various topics such as product requirements, technology specifications, project schedules A proven dedication to continuous self-improvement Description We are seeking an expert, innovative, meticulous Materials specialist as part of a new team focused on building and crafting an extraordinary materials environment for electro-mechanical materials in PCB, flexible printed circuit and PCB assemblies. You will have a clear track record of Materials Management for performance applications, that can work proactively supporting the build up of this new team. You will work with Engineering, Technology and Environmental guides - and you will be responsible to define, develop, qualify and handle materials for use in all of Apple’s amazing products. An encouraging, and pro-active style, great communication, detailed work planning and project definition, collaboration with Apple and supplier professionals, driving of objectives and roadmaps, and strong attention to detail are all encouraged. Do you fit the bill? Education & Experience Material Science or Materials Engineering technical qualification At least 3 years of experience in a role dealing with high performance materials Fundamentals in material engineering and process design, preferably in the field of Printed Circuit Board and or flexible printed circuits Deep understanding of materials analysis methodologies e.g. strain rate dependent testing, high frequency dielectric property measurement Experience with relevant materials database and simulation tools Role Number: 200346733

Summary Apple is looking for a Materials Engineer to join Panel Process and Optics (PPO) Engineering team. Materials Engineer is responsible for developing new materials and supporting processes that enable innovative manufacturing technologies to solve sophisticated design challenges that have direct impact to future product, quality and delivery of Apple Displays & Touch! The individual in this role will serve as a focal point in the material development/selection/process development of sophisticated key process modules from the concept/architecture stage through product engineering validation builds. We work at a fast pace and require everyone to be highly self motivated! Our successful candidate needs to be a flexible problem solver and be able to problem-solve outside of their respective technical area. Key Qualifications Sound knowledge and understanding of polymer chemistry/formulations, adhesives and polymer physics to able to interact seamlessly with material vendors. Hands-on experience in the development of new materials and proven ability to build new material specifications. Ability to work backwards from product requirements to property specifications to material formulation, process optimization and material selection based on sound understanding of structure - property - processing - performance relations. Self-starter with proven ability to lead a project from lab scale development to high volume production without major last minute surprises Demonstrated failure mode analysis, root cause investigation, and problem solving for product yield and quality issue. Demonstrated ability to perform DOE, data analysis, SPC control. Excellent written & verbal communication skills and proven leadership ability. Project Management- Excellent data handling, documentation, critical milestone creation, and organization skill. Ability for International business travel to support project implementation and collaborate with external vendors for product manufacturing. Description New material development with vendors - Lead material suppliers to develop new display materials for specific programs within a given timeline. Developing fundamental understanding of structure-property relationships. Material search and selection - Select commercially available or existing materials that meet material success criteria. Failure Analysis - Lead failure analysis investigations for material interactions in sophisticated display stack-ups. Leverage expertise in analytical test methods to understand root cause and develop corrective actions. Data analysis – Develop new material characterization methods, conduct tests, data analysis, and troubleshooting. Process Development - Leads design and development of technically complex manufacturing processes including material selection, parameter optimization, equipment, metrology and system design to enable new product designs and functional requirements. Process FMEA - Lead PFMEA for new process technology. Cross-functional interaction with Product Design, Display Engineering, Display Operations and international vendors. Keep tabs on relevant industrial material and process manufacturing technical trends. Education & Experience Ph.D. M.S. or B.S. degree in Chemistry, Material science, or Chemical Engineer with experience in Material/Chemical industries Role Number: 200437694

Summary Why Apple? At Apple we believe our products begin with our people. By hiring a diverse team we drive creative thought. By giving that team everything they need we drive innovation. By hiring incredible engineers we drive precision. And through our collaborative process we create memorable experiences for our customers. These elements come together to make Apple an amazing environment for motivated people to do the greatest work of their lives. Why Softgoods? Apple’s Softgoods Engineering team works with textiles, composites, silicones and soft polymers. Our mission is to use these incredible materials to enable new product categories, and to enhance Apple’s existing product lines. Bringing Apple engineering and precision to products made of soft materials is an exciting challenge and requires a creative and open minded approach. We have a talented team of people from a wide variety of backgrounds. We all work together in a beautiful customized lab where we design, engineer and develop the best softgoods products in the world. If this sounds like an exciting challenge, we hope you will consider a place in our team! What is the role? We are seeking an enthusiastic engineer to drive material development in the areas of high performance polymers and composites. The position requires you to drive strategic development of next generation materials, engage in hands-on project-based work, and establish key material supplier relationships for advancing innovation in material sustainability. We encourage anyone who is passionate about sustainability and the environment, building relationships, developing top technical talent, and approaching problem solving with curiosity and imagination to apply. We value people with a desire to learn new skills and a mindset that challenging questions are opportunities for insight. To that end, we are committed to professional development across all aspects of materials and communication, with mentorship and training opportunities both within and outside Apple. Key Qualifications In-depth understanding of polymer science and materials structure/property/performance relationships Strong background in developing, characterizing and specifying polymer material for composites, performance coatings, adhesives and fibers applications in quantitative terms Expertise in statistical analysis and driving material development by establishing DoE methods Proven records in providing corrective action to solve complex problems and attention to details to ensure a successful product launch Effective in managing multiple projects to achieve rigorous standards and meet demanding schedules Proven track record in peer collaboration and teamwork Comfort working both independently and collaboratively on tight deadlines in a supportive environment Strong attention to detail and resolution to solve complex problems Description - Collaborate with industrial design, product design and manufacturing teams on material selection, design feasibility and manufacturing process development - Scoping new sustainable technology/material scoping, including evaluation of supplier capabilities towards developing sustainable materials - Creation of material specifications based on critical to quality attributes for product design - Utilize appropriate statistical and/or data analysis tools that translate these material critical attributes into repeatable and capable manufacturing process - Establish and manage relationships with manufacturers/suppliers to identify emerging technologies and innovation in the area of material sustainability and circularity . Collaborate with them on the development of new technologies to meet Apple’s product roadmap needs Education & Experience - MS or PhD in Material Science & Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Polymer Science & Engineering or related fields - 2-3+ years proven experience in material engineering preferred Role Number: 200433832

Summary When was the last time you enjoyed a box as much as the product inside? At Apple, every customer interaction is an opportunity for surprise and delight! This philosophy extends beyond the product to its packaging, where every detail is thoughtfully considered. The Packaging PD team is a diverse group of people responsible for the design and execution of structural packaging for all Apple products - from shippers to finished goods boxes. Our packaging delivers an outstanding customer experience, while protecting products throughout the shipping environment, and advancing Apple’s sustainability goals. We collaborate with a wide range of teams including Industrial Design, Marketing, Environmental, Operations and many others during the design process. We are seeking someone who approaches problem solving with passion, creativity, and curiosity. Apple’s approach to packaging is unique, so we value people who are eager to learn new skills and further improve their knowledge of packaging design, manufacturing processes, and sustainable materials. We welcome fresh influences from outside the standard packaging industry to promote innovation in creative ways. The Packaging Materials team collaborates with a wide range of partners to develop the highest quality materials with careful consideration of environmental impact. The position requires you to drive strategic next generation materials, engage in hands-on project-based work, and establish key material supplier relationships with a sharp focus on material and process sustainability. The job is based in Cupertino and will require travel to international sites about 20% of the time. Key Qualifications In-depth expertise in material science, structure-property relationships, and characterization of material performance for structural and cosmetic applications, in quantitative terms Experience working with cross functional groups to drive material selection and development Effective in leading multiple development projects simultaneously with overseas vendors to achieve high standards and meet fast-paced schedules Effective communication skills. Specifically, you are able to explain complex issues to a variety of audiences, are able to think about the big picture when communicating, and can summarize technical details succinctly. Experience with material processing, testing and developing materials for large-scale manufacturing is preferred Experience with paper, fiber, or bio-based materials is preferred. Description - Work cooperatively across functions to understand the application requirements and accurately translate product-level requirements into material-level properties - Curate material portfolio and recommend off-the-shelf materials - Develop tools to streamline material selection and share material knowledge cross-functionally - Drive hands-on scientific studies of material performance, from developing test methods/experimentation plans, applying robust DoE methods and statistical analysis of data to evaluate and specify material parameters critical to quality. - Establish and develop relationships with manufacturers/suppliers to identify emerging technologies. Collaborate with partner industries and companies to develop and execute future strategy for environmentally-responsible material solutions. - Communicate findings in a clear, concise manner to multiple levels of audiences, including visualization of data. Develop practical recommendations to inform material selection, design feasibility, and manufacturing process development Education & Experience - MS or PhD with 3+ years of industry experience in Material Science & Engineering, Polymer Science, Fiber Science, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering with an emphasis in Materials, Process Engineering, Packaging or related fields. Additional Requirements Apple’s most important resource, our soul, is our people. Apple benefits help further the well-being of our employees and their families in meaningful ways. No matter where you work at Apple, you can take advantage of our health and wellness resources and time-away programs. We’re proud to provide stock grants to employees at all levels of the company, and we also give employees the option to buy Apple stock at a discount — both offer everyone at Apple the chance to share in the company’s success. You’ll discover many more benefits of working at Apple, such as programs that match your charitable contributions, reimburse you for continuing your education and give you special employee pricing on Apple products Apple benefits programs vary by country and are subject to eligibility requirements. Apple is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. Apple is a drug-free workplace. Role Number: 200284158

Summary Imagine what you could do here. World Class operational excellence is a cornerstone of Apple's ability to consistently surprise and delight our customers. The WW Materials Program Manager plays a critical role in ensuring operational success for the Procurement organization. In this role, you will be responsible for materials readiness, availability, and visibility. This is a strategic supply chain role, interacting with our Contract Manufacturers (CMs) and internal core teams, encompassing critical component planning, allocation direction, supply flexibility modeling, and materials liability management. Do you have a passion for complex supply chain operations? We hope you will consider joining our team. Key Qualifications • Ability to problem-solve and influence others through relationships and data • Advanced modeling and predictive analytical skills; "Advanced User" of MS Excel with deep understanding of Excel techniques. VBA, SQL, Tableau, or similar data visualization tools a plus. • Professional experience with complex supply chain, technical expertise, or prior OEM management experience preferred. • Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present to management required. • International experience and Mandarin, Japanese, Vietnamese language skills a plus. Description Do you enjoy seeing products come to life? The MPM will manage the CTB ("clear to build") process with suppliers and OEMs, ensuring that we have efficient process and clear visibility on our procurement strategy. Your successful ability to partner with OEMs and the sourcing team on material strategy will directly impact our product success. • Clear-to-Build (CTB) Management: provide visibility to materials supply, highlighting projected coverage and constraints. CTB projections govern what the Supply-Demand Managers (SDM) can commit to customers and are a key input to revenue projections provided to our C-level executives. • Partner with the CM to develop a model that incorporates the specific supply chain and materials flow details to project availability in support of our supply/demand goals. • Create allocation strategies for constrained materials by developing models across factories, programs, and lines of business. Provide allocation direction to Global Supply Managers and Apple Suppliers. • Challenge and influence Demand Planning and Strategic Sourcing teams to improve allocation and maximize revenue. • Identify E & O and other material risk, recommend critical course of action to leadership, and own the efforts to mitigate liability to the business. • Develop strategic roadmap for the phase‐out of obsolete parts and new product materials. • Prepare and communicate critical Materials updates at weekly Sustaining Executive Program reviews; maintain executive reports and summaries, providing accurate and timely data to leadership on a weekly basis. • Through a deep understanding of our commodity terms, ensure the logistical flow of materials necessary to meet production schedules, inventory control requirements, and ongoing material line support. Education & Experience • Bachelor's Degree with minimum 3+ years of professional experience required. • MBA or Master's Degree in Supply Chain, Engineering, or Operations Management preferred. Role Number: 200381929

jobTitle: Mechanical Design Engineer - Product Design Architecture
jobDescription: Summary In this position, you will play a key role in developing the next generation of Mac and iPad devices. We will work closely within our product design team to develop ground-breaking core technologies that will surprise and delight our customers. The same passion for innovation that goes into our products also applies to our practices - strengthening our commitment to leave the world a better place. Since we are inventing entirely new product forms and features, you will be interacting with engineers across many disciplines in the company. The ‘Characterization and Advanced Prototyping’ team defines new test methods to gather data about potential design solutions in order to define performance metrics and requirements to create reliable products for the customer. Our team is passionate about systems thinking: Breaking complex technologies down to their fundamental components. Our unique and small team is highly collaborative and values mechanical intuition that can guide us towards great hardware innovation! Key Qualifications 3D CAD modeling (UG preferred) Fundamental knowledge of materials (plastics/metals/glass/composites) Knowledge of manufacturing methods (forming, injection molding, CNC, etc.) Experience in design characterization, DOEs (design of experiment), and failure analysis Strong analytical/problem solving skills and ability to use statistical tools Knowledge of finite element analysis theory Excellent communication skills Attention to detail in building precision models and test vehicles Experience in Python and MATLAB Description - Assisting in the development of new product concepts, technologies, manufacturing & integration methods - Prototyping new product ideas by 3D modeling, fabricating, and assembling - Designing fixtures/test vehicles and running tests to characterize multiple design options - Retrofitting products with new features/technologies to evaluate performance and reliability - Gathering, analyzing and presenting data to inform key design decisions Education & Experience - B.S. in mechanical engineering (5+ years demonstrated ability in industry) Role Number: 200400559

jobTitle: Mechanical Design Engineer - Sensing Product Design
jobDescription: Summary The Sensing Product Design team is looking for a talented mechanical engineer to build great experiences and bring Apple products to life. We are the team developing many of the sensors that changed the way people interact with their technology. Touch redefined the phone and tablet, TouchID seamlessly secured them, and the heart rate monitor let you keep tabs on yourself. In this role, you will be responsible for specifying, developing, characterizing and validating touch sensing systems. You should be familiar with sensor technologies, along with related product integration and manufacturing technologies. Key Qualifications 2+ years of hands-on experience designing mechanical components or systems for a production environment. Proficiency in 2D drafting, 3D conceptual modeling (NX preferred), tolerance analysis, and design trade-offs. Strong mechanical engineering analytical skills. Experience using FEA to drive design decisions is strongly preferred Ability to collect and use data to inform decisions and fuel debate in an open and intellectually honest manner. Clear and concise communication skills with ability to adapt written and verbal messaging for a variety of audiences. Cross-disciplinary approach to design; collaborates with a diverse team as well as external vendors to solve complex problems and achieve project goals. Demonstrated ability to drive failure analysis to determine root cause and develop effective corrective actions. Nice-to-have Skills: Consumer electronics knowledge is preferred; familiarity with capacitive sensing technology is a strong plus Knowledge of basic engineering materials (plastics and adhesives) and manufacturing processes, specifically in high-volume mass production Detail oriented and capable of handling multiple assignments at once Curious, willing to learn new skills, and share knowledge Working experience or academic training in: Sensors, electrical circuit design, thin film technologies Programming and scripting (MATLAB or Python preferred) Tolerance analysis and process capability analysis Statistical and regression analysis, response surface modeling (JMP or Minitab) Finite Element Analysis (FEA) of mechanical, thermal, static/dynamic environment (Ansys, Abaqus, Comsol) Nonlinear material characterization Description You will own the end-to-end design, development and validation of sensing technology into Apple’s portfolio of products. You will work with a talented multifunctional team to generate design concepts, and as the mechanical expert you will be responsible for engineering analysis and documentation for your piece of the project. You will be expected to: Identify design tradeoffs and risks to choose viable paths forward. Apply good experiment design and the scientific method to reduce design risk early. Ensure a ‘guarantee by design’ approach with tolerance studies and simulation to ensure designs meet requirements over manufacturing, process, and reliability conditions. Drive issue resolution to meet Apple’s high customer experience and industrial design standards. Experience with high volume mass production or consumer electronics are a plus. In the prototyping and validation phases, you will support external manufacturing vendors with process development and root cause analysis for issues found during testing. Support for our vendors includes international travel between 15% and 25%. At the end of the extraordinary team effort, your work will be in the hands of millions of people making a visible difference in their daily lives. Education & Experience Bachelor/MS/PhD degree in engineering Minimum of 2 years of relevant industry experience or PhD degree in related area. Role Number: 200284913

jobTitle: Mechanical Design Engineer - Sensing Product Design
jobDescription: Summary We live in a mobile and device driven world where knowledge of the physical world around us is needed. We rely on this knowledge to get around, to learn about our environment and to enable spectacular new features for custom applications. Apple is meeting those needs as robustly and as creatively as possible and is interested in people who want to help meet that commitment. The success we are striving will be the result of very skilled people working in an environment which cultivates creativity, partnership, and thinking of old problems in new ways. If that sounds like the kind of environment that you find intriguing, then let's talk. These elements come together to make Apple an amazing environment for motivated people to do the greatest work of their lives. You will become part of a team that sets the standard in fostering excellence, creativity and innovation. Will you help us design the next generation of revolutionary Apple products? The Sensing Product Design team is looking for a mechanical engineer to build great experiences and bring Apple products to life. We are the team developing many of the sensors that changed the way people interact with their technology. Touch redefined the phone and tablet, TouchID seamlessly secured them, and the heart rate monitor let you keep tabs on yourself. In this role, you will be responsible for specifying, developing, characterizing and validating touch sensing systems. You should be familiar with sensor technologies, along with related product integration and manufacturing technologies. Key Qualifications 2+ years of hands-on experience crafting mechanical components or systems for a production environment. Proficiency in 2D drafting, 3D conceptual modeling (NX preferred), tolerance analysis, and design trade-offs. Strong mechanical engineering analytical skills. Ability to collect and use data to advise decisions and fuel debate in an open and intellectually transparent manner. You will work with a hardworking multifunctional team to generate design concepts, and as the mechanical expert you will be responsible for engineering analysis and documentation for your piece of the project. You will be expected to: - Identify design tradeoffs and risks to choose viable paths forward. - Apply good experiment design and the scientific method to reduce design risk early. - Ensure a ‘guarantee by design’ approach with tolerance studies and simulation to ensure designs meet requirements over manufacturing, process, and reliability conditions. - Drive issue resolution to meet Apple’s high customer experience and industrial design standards. Experience with high volume mass production or consumer electronics are a plus. In the prototyping and validation phases, you will support external manufacturing vendors with process development and root cause analysis for issues found during testing. Support for our vendors includes international travel between 15% and 25%. At the end of the extraordinary team effort, your work will be in the hands of millions of people making a visible difference in their daily lives. Education & Experience BSME required; MSME, PhD preferred (or equivalent) Additional Requirements Preferred: Consumer electronics knowledge is preferred; familiarity with capacitive sensing technology is a strong plus. Knowledge of basic engineering materials (plastics and adhesives) and manufacturing processes, specifically in high-volume mass production. Detail orientated and capable of balancing multiple assignments at once. Curious, willing to learn new skills, and share knowledge Working experience or academic training in: - Sensors, electrical circuit design, thin film technologies - Programming and scripting (MATLAB or Python preferred) - Tolerance analysis and process capability analysis - Statistical and regression analysis, response surface modeling (JMP or Minitab) - Finite Element Analysis (FEA) of mechanical, thermal, static/dynamic environment (Ansys, Abaqus, Comsol) - Nonlinear material characterization Role Number: 200339299

Summary Why Apple? At Apple, we believe our products begin with our people. By hiring a diverse team we drive creative thought. By giving that team everything they need we drive innovation. By hiring incredible engineers we drive precision. And through our collaborative process we create memorable experiences for our customers. These elements come together to make Apple an amazing environment for motivated people to do the greatest work of their lives. Why Softgoods? Apple’s Softgoods Engineering team is relatively new to Apple. We work with textiles, leather, silicone and soft polymers. Our mission is to use these incredible materials to enable new product categories, and to enhance Apple’s existing product lines. Bringing Apple engineering and precision to products made of soft materials is an exciting challenge and requires a creative and open minded approach. We have an inclusive and talented team of people, from a wide variety of backgrounds. We all work together in a beautiful customized lab where we design, engineer, and develop the best Softgoods products in the world. If this sounds like an exciting challenge, we hope you will consider a place in our team! Key Qualifications At least 3 years of experience in production part design utilizing a variety of engineering materials Good engineering fundamentals (beam bending, free body diagrams, GD&T, etc…) 3D and 2D CAD skills (NX preferred) Solid verbal and written presentation skills (Keynote or Powerpoint) Experience using spreadsheets to analyze engineering data (FAI/CPK, tolerance analysis) Experience engaging with manufacturers Creative problem solving, with experience in failure analysis, root cause investigation, and DOE creation BS in Mechanical Engineering OTHER SKILLS AND TRAINING WE LIKE TO SEE: Knowledge of soft goods materials (synthetics, leather, adhesives) Knowledge of soft goods assembly process (bonding, cutting, stitching) MS degree in Engineering Description We are looking for a highly motivated product design engineering lead. You will be part of a cross-functional team to conceive, design, validate, and launch exciting new products. You will work closely with many different groups, including Industrial Design, System PD, Hardware Engineering, Operations, Packaging, Reliability, and Software. The team is responsible for products in the following categories: iPhone accessories, iPad accessories, Watch bands, Audio, as well as supporting other teams at Apple that wish to use soft goods materials in their designs. By joining our team, you will work side by side with your teammates inside Apple and at our partner facilities to define CAD, create drawings, and collaborate with vendors to produce these parts. You will perform engineering analyses on your designs using appropriate methods such as hand calculation, computer simulation, FEA, and dimensional tolerance analysis. You will assemble early prototypes, travel to China to support engineering builds, and solve problems on the assembly line. Education & Experience BS in Mechanical Engineering. This role pays between $117,500 and $217,500, and your actual base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. You’ll also receive other benefits: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. jobDescription: Summary Mac… iPod… iPhone… iPad… WATCH… what’s next? In this role, you will join a team of talented Engineering Program Managers specializing in managing, prioritizing and executing day-to-day activities to meet the overall program objectives of the Product Design team responsible for the next new product category at Apple. Your role will include frequent multi-disciplinary collaboration with teams like Product Design, Industrial Design, Materials, Manufacturing, SoC, Display, Camera, Antenna, Battery, and more for a new product category for Apple. Key Qualifications 5+ years of combined experience in program management and mechanical/electrical engineering delivering products comprised of multiple materials and having high aesthetic quality Experience leading full life-cycle product development in highly dynamic and ambiguous work environments, supporting the mechanical assembly and integration of multiple technologies Excellent communication, teamwork, and cross-functional engagement skills are critical Wide knowledge of product development processes including detailed understanding of manufacturing processes and tooling timelines Ability to anticipate functional direction and roadblocks, prioritize parallel closure paths, and effectively distill and communicate relevant data to the appropriate functional teams, including leadership Self-motivated and dedicated with demonstrated creative and critical thinking capabilities Ability to evolve and adapt well with rapid development cycles; can set direction when faced with ambiguity Experience engaging with manufacturers, DFM and FAI/CPK reports Experience working with Product Design, Industrial Design, Operations, and System Architecture Description This is a hands-on programmatic role where you and your team will be responsible for delivering the mechanical assembly through the entire program life-cycle, from architecture definition and early design to mass production You will drive the program through the entire development process, partnering with our Design, Operations and Test functions to ensure its success You will create and maintain streamlined program schedules by redirecting pitfalls and developing an improved course of action. You will collaborate and facilitate cross-functional communication across engineering, operations, design teams, and our OEM/development vendors to meet ambitious quality, schedule and cost goals. You will work to solve issues to closure by tracking progress, prioritizing FA, helping to identify root cause and working with our cross-functional partners to implement corrective action You will drive the manufacturing and assembly of early prototypes, manage budget and authorize payment, travel internationally to support engineering builds, and solve problems on the assembly line. You will offer multiple levels of status updates across a wide spectrum of individual contributors to executive management. You possess strong presentation skills. Education & Experience BSEE/ME degree or equivalent. MS degree preferred Role Number: 200441775

Summary Help Apple grow the product structural analysis team for iPad, iPhone, Mac, Watch, and many other Apple products. We are responsible for FEA modeling, engineering analysis, & material characterization, along with verification and validation of mechanical simulation models. Key Qualifications Thorough knowledge of Solid Mechanics and Strength of Materials Passion for creating innovative, high quality products Outstanding written and verbal communication skills Desire to work in a fast-paced environment Description We are fully integrated with the product design team from the earliest stages, analyzing and informing the mechanical design of ground breaking products. As part of our team, you will work with the multi-functional teams within Apple and with outside vendors to characterize the strength of raw materials and components. Education & Experience BS in Mechanical Engineering, Applied Mechanics, or similar, MS/PhD preferred Additional Requirements Additional Experience in any or all of the following areas would be preferred: - Static and dynamic finite element analysis (ideally in handheld/portable/wearable electronic products) - FEA software such as Abaqus or similar - Good modeling practices including model validation techniques - Failure modeling of different classes of materials - Testing including methods using Digital Image Correlation, Universal Testing Machines, and Dynamic Mechanical Analysis Role Number: 200169799

Summary At Apple great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences. We are seeking an experienced designer to join our App Store Product Design team in an exciting and fast-paced organization. The ideal designer will have a passion for taking on complex problems and designing elegant, simple solutions that surprise and delight users. We’ll provide you with unparalleled levels of opportunity and resources, with the goal of creating experiences that influence the industry, as well as people’s lives. By constantly focusing on the consumer, you’ll create products that are not only amazing to look at, but also intuitive and useful to billions of people worldwide. Join this team if you’re committed to making each human interaction — visual, audial, and haptic — amazing for our customers. Key Qualifications 8+ years work experience An excellent on-line portfolio showcasing UX, UI and visual design work for mobile, desktop TV and web. A command of visual and communication design principles Ability to communicate design concepts through sketches and wireframes. Highly skilled in Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, Keynote and other design tools. Ability to prototype in HTML/CSS/JavaScript, AfterEffects, or other tools. Experience in designing iOS app experiences from start to finish as a product designer with familiarity of iOS development. Enthusiasm for an iterative design process, inspired by group critique. Able to function independently and in a team environment, with excellent collaboration skills. Excellent communication and presentation skills; both written and verbal. Previous experience working in e-commerce environment is a plus. A deep understanding of the Apple design aesthetic, UI, and history A passion for Apple, it’s products, and its customers is a requirement. Description The App Store Product Design team is looking for an extraordinary hands-on digital product designer to work across all our platforms, including iOS, Mac, TV and web. You will be responsible for researching, designing, and prototyping new user experiences based on product requirements. Deliverables include design mockups, prototyping, production of visual assets, and documentation required for proper implementation. You flourish in a dynamic, ever-changing, and deadline driven environment. You are a natural collaborator and a phenomenal communicator, able to develop and present design ideas in a large team environment. You will work closely with cross-functional teams such as Engineering, Production, Product Marketing, and Senior Management. Prior experience working within a technical environment is a key requirement. You should possess extraordinary visual and user interface design skills, as well as user-centered design principals. You have an affinity for consistency, color use, typography, and a keen eye for subtle details. While exercising a good eye for aesthetics, you are able to grasp and distill highly complex issues and translate them into clean, focused, understandable solutions. Strong communication skills and ability to stay highly organized is essential. Interest in new technologies in web, mobile, and other devices is required. You should be a self-starter, self-motivated, able to work independently, and perform multiple tasks under minimal supervision. The work that you design will be seen and experienced by millions of people around the world, every month. Education & Experience Bachelors Degree in Interaction, Graphic Design, Media Arts or similar. Role Number: 200357039

Summary At Apple great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences. The Services Platform design team develops new products and works on features to grow existing subscription services and commerce ecosystems. We are seeking an enthusiastic Design Producer to support the Services Platform design team. Often supporting multiple concurrent projects with competing priorities, the Design Producer will work closely with design, business, marketing, and engineering teams, as well as executive stakeholders. In collaboration with their partners, they will work to clarify project requirements, define design goals and strategy, lead and facilitate design reviews, and represent design in cross-functional forums to ensure a quality launch of the final feature. With Design at the heart of Apple and the work that we do, the Design Producer will play a big part in upholding these values and driving innovation and creativity though our design work. This individual has a passion for commerce systems, growing services, and a thorough knowledge of today’s landscape. Key Qualifications 5+ years as a producer in software design, digital or creative agency experience preferred. Experience leading and driving consumer facing design initiatives. Keen ability to build trust with cross functional partners and internal design members. Proven ability to triage and prioritize design requests with competing priorities. Thorough understanding of UX/UI ideation, execution, and delivery processes. Thorough understanding of desktop and native mobile design best practices. Proven ability to meet deadlines and drive results while juggling many projects and priorities. Keen ability to grasp complexity quickly and to focus on key issues. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Meticulous attention to detail. Proficient with Keynote and Quip. Basic Sketch knowledge. A passion for Apple, its products, and its customers. A passion for commerce systems and growth. Description The Services Platform Design Producer will play a big part in driving innovation and creativity through our design work. They will be part of a number of cross-functional teams working on features to grow the commerce ecosystem and subscriptions landscape within Apple. We seek someone who works collaboratively, has a positive outlook and excellent communication skills, is resourceful and organized, and has a passion for design. Responsibilities * Manage cross functional relationships and partnerships while representing the design team. * Triaging incoming requests and prioritize design work * Facilitate meetings and design reviews. * Gather key ideas, decisions, issues, and action items in meeting notes. * Partner with Design DRIs to deliver action items or source additional information. * Support design brainstorms and workshops. * Track and report project health on a weekly basis, including communicating status and impending or projected results. * Negotiate priorities for the design team given limited resources and ambitious schedules. * Support team in roadmap planning and cross-functional shares. * Ensure timely handoff of design guidelines and visual specs to engineering. * Review builds to ensure design integrity has remained intact during implementation. * Constantly improve processes and communications in an ever-changing, fast-paced working environment. Education & Experience BA/BS or equivalent Pay & Benefits At Apple, your base pay is one part of your total compensation package. This role pays between $131,000 and $242,000, and your actual base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Apple employees also have the opportunity to own shares of Apple stock, because all Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, as well as a discount when purchasing Apple stock if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive other benefits: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits. Note: Apple benefits programs are subject to eligibility requirements. Role Number: 200394722

Summary Apple Services is looking for an outstanding designer to join the Account & Identity team to build phenomenal web experiences that deliver on the Apple values of simplicity, control, and privacy. Our users can face difficult to understand situations which we must present simply and clearly. Our team focuses on the challenges around accounts while forging elements of identity throughout our ecosystem. Join a team working on this infrastructure used by hundreds of millions of users every day! Key Qualifications 5+ years work experience with a focus on product design and UI for the web Strong command of visual and communication design principles Rigorous attention to detail while being creative and resourceful Enthusiasm for an iterative design process, inspired by group critique Flexible and comfortable with ambiguity and changes during a project Able to clearly communicate concepts and designs through sketches, wireframes, high-fidelity comps, and prototypes Expertise documenting interaction details, visual design specifications and QA of the implemented product Highly skilled in Sketch, Keynote, Photoshop, and other design tools Description Our designers build Apple-caliber solutions for our users, shepherding designs from initial ideation, through rapid iteration, to pixel-perfect implementation. We enjoy a high level of ownership and pride in our work, with designers presenting and taking criticism directly. This position requires deep understanding of subjects like account security, legal requirements, and UX and UI patterns across Apple platforms and the web. Using your strong communication skills you’ll get to work closely with other designers, engineering, product marketing, and presenting to executive sponsors. We need a product designer who can focus on our web sites for Apple ID and Data & Privacy, while bringing web design expertise to account creation, sign-in, and even email. This position will also contribute to our overall account efforts and identity work. Our web properties were recently overhauled with a new original design system, which will need to be maintained and extended to allow for wider use and additional functionality. Our longer term explorative projects are more conceptual and require big thinking that incorporates a deep understanding of Apple values and perspective — which often takes time to develop. The ideal candidate has the expertise necessary to be able to successfully design Apple-branded user experiences that don’t feel out of place on the web, or in the context of usage on third-party platforms such as Android and Windows. Education & Experience BFA, BA, MA, or MS Role Number: 200425360

Summary Apple’s Applications group is seeking a senior product designer who brings simple and delightful experiences to life. This product designer has a blend of visual and interaction design skills and will work on some of the most beloved apps on our platforms! You will collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team of designers to craft experiences that shape industries and inform people’s daily lives. Key Qualifications 5+ years of design experience in a design studio or as a product designer. A digital design portfolio that demonstrates the breadth of your skill which you can also speak to and explain in more detail. You are a critical thinker who is imaginative, creative, and inventive. You collaborate while inspiring other teammates. You can apply principles of visual design (hierarchy, balance, contrast) to new interfaces. You've mastered design tools that allow you to get your ideas across, whether its Sketch, Illustrator, or otherwise. You are passionate about making every detail count, but you can see the bigger picture at the same time. Through clear communication, compelling storytelling, and navigating contending interests and requests with nuance, you are capable yet comfortable with loose structure and ambiguity. Description We craft for delight within the Applications group— designing clear, high-impact experiences that are welcoming and intuitive. You will advocate for the human experience as you craft new and innovative interactions by working on information architectures, navigation models, and interfaces that shape the very way people perceive and understand our products. Leading with empathy, you will map out user flows, use cases, and systems that make even our newest products immediately recognizable, inclusive, and fun! We take complex and sometimes ambiguous problem spaces and simplify them into clear stories and actionable proposals. We will collaboratively dial into the details while also safeguarding a seamless experience from end to end. All the while, you’ll push concepts further with teammates, and your unique voice will make the final output stronger. You’ll convey all the thought and decisions that went into your work to a broad audience as you diplomatically navigate it through various review cycles, building consensus along the way. You’ll play a meaningful role working alongside engineers and QA to shepherd a phenomenal final product to our customers hands. Education & Experience Degree in human interaction, sociology, psychology, interaction design, visual design, or equivalent Role Number: 200401409

Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. jobDescription: Summary At Apple, we work every day to create products and services that enrich people’s lives. Are you a great collaborator and partner? If you’ve got a background in digital advertising and/or financial system development, this role may be a great opportunity for you! Summary At Apple, we believe in the power of technology to enrich people's lives. For the Ad Platforms team, this means creating digital advertising solutions that benefit marketers and enhance the experience people have on Apple devices while respecting their privacy. Apple Search Ads helps developers and marketers drive discovery of their apps on the App Store. Display ads on Apple News and Stocks help advertisers promote their products alongside trusted content in a brand-safe environment. We're looking for a hardworking product marketer to help drive the success of new Ad Platforms products and features with customers. As a key member of the Ad Platforms product marketing team, you’ll help shape product strategy and business decisions through research, cross-functional partnerships, and strong go-to-market programs. You’ll work on marketing initiatives that drive awareness and adoption of our products, and you’ll represent the voice of the customer to influence the product roadmap and requirements. You’ll be a product authority with extraordinary attention to detail and a willingness to scrutinize deliverables - from product screens to best practices content to sales enablement content - ensuring accuracy and clarity. You’ll understand the small and medium business customer, and articulate their needs to the product and engineering teams. You’ll create product positioning, messaging, and product education to align internal teams and drive customer engagement. Do you have a B2B product marketing background, experience with small and medium business customers, and a deep understanding of the digital advertising landscape? Join our team! Key Qualifications 5+ years as a product marketer in the tech or digital advertising industry specifically for small and medium business customers. Extraordinary attention to detail, especially when crafting and reviewing content for accuracy and clarity. Comprehensive understanding of the product development and go-to-market process. Proven success developing and delivering product positioning, value propositions, and narratives. Exceptional written and oral communication skills, storytelling skills, and strong ability to facilitate discussions and deliver presentations. Effective interpersonal skills with the ability to listen and socialize ideas across functions. Excellent project management, organizational, analytical, and creative thinking skills. jobTitle: Retail Online Desktop Support Project Lead
jobDescription: Summary The people here at Apple don’t just build products — we craft the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. We draw on the differences in who we are, what we’ve experienced, and how we think. Because to create products that serve everyone, we believe in including everyone. Role Number: 200417195

jobTitle: Robotics Software Engineer, Autonomous Systems - SPG
jobDescription: Summary Apple SPG (Special Projects Group) is looking for talented robotics and software engineers to join our team to push the boundaries of autonomous planning algorithms (behavior, predictions, motion planning, and architecture). Key Qualifications Background in any of the following areas: behavior planning/decision-making, predictions, machine learning, motion planning (sampling, search based planning, optimization), estimation, control, and/or high-performance real-time algorithms. Experience programming autonomous robots, modeling multi-agent systems, and developing algorithms for them. Strong C++ and/or Python development skills. Solid understanding of advanced algorithms and data structures. 2+ years of professional or equivalent experience. You must be hands-on, eager, curious and never satisfied with the status quo. You must love learning and being challenged. Description You will develop cutting edge robotics technology at the intersection of machine learning, AI, and classical robotics. This involves the design and implementation of algorithms that run on a robot in real-time in a safety critical application that involves autonomous interactions with the surrounding world in an uncontrolled environment. You will test and deploy your work in simulation and in the real world on state-of-the-art robotics hardware. You will contribute to the development of an ambitious and innovative projects as part of a dedicated team of world-class engineers. Education & Experience M.Sc., or Ph.D. in computer science, engineering, or equivalent professional experience. Additional Requirements Preferred Experience: • Designed one or more machine-learned approaches to solve a robotics problem. • Experience with cloud-based tools to automate experiments and analysis at scale. • Familiarity with real-time, multi-process, multi-threaded coding. • Comfort using the command line in Linux. • Experience with 3D geometric math. • Comfortable with collaboration tools for programming Role Number: 200425943

Summary SPG group is looking for an exceptional engineer with multi-disciplinary product development experience with safety critical systems such as high voltage safety, battery safety, mechanical safety as well as experience in hazard and risk analysis and requirements development. Summary The Safety Management (SMS)Lead is responsible for supporting the Operational Safety Management Lead in developing and implementing a safety management safety (SMS) program. A successful Safety Management Lead is a natural leader and facilitator, is driven and a self starter, is detail oriented and extremely organized, excels in challenging and complex environments, is able to influence areas of an organization that are not direct reports nor within their immediate department, excels in program/project management; communicates with ease at all levels; thrives in an ambiguous, ever fluid environment; is adept at taking action and resolving conflict; manages through relationships and influence; and is at ease in high stress environments. Key Qualifications Excellent leadership and communication skills Comfortable in a dynamic development environment Excitement and passion to create amazing and safe products Driven to innovate Safety Management background working with autonomous or fleet operations in safety critical industries (aviation, trucking, AV dev, etc) Expert in managing SMS and enhancing a positive safety culture Strong history of successful implementation and management of SMS programs including Safety Policy, Safety Risk Management, Safety Assurance, Safety Promotion Description Together with the Operational Safety Management Lead, you will lead the implementation and management of the organization’s SMS program within Apple. As a key stakeholder of the SMS program, either through direct involvement and/or influence, you will ensure successful implementation and on-going management of the organization’s SMS program. • Oversee the SMS Program to include: development of the SMS safety policy requirements, coordinate and facilitate safety risk information and decisions by the appropriate organizational leadership, track SMS risk mitigation actions and maintain safety risk registry, assist in safety promotion programs, awareness and education of key organizational personnel, utilize and trend data from safety reporting program. • Support the Leadership team in the administration, tracking and planning of Leadership’s Safety Management Committee. • Ensure day to day oversight of the workings of the design, continued improvement and management of the SMS. • Provide solid documentation of the SMS program and manage metrics that allows Safety performance and quality to be tracked over time to provide for a healthy organizational SMS program.  • Manage relationship with representatives from all organizational identified within the scope of the SMS. • Develop creative solutions to allow for SAFE and discrete development and testing operations. • Provide periodic safety performance and strategy updates to senior management. • Look to solve problems rather than report on them. Education & Experience Bachelors degree Role Number: 200361144

Summary Mac… iPod… iPhone… iPad… WATCH… what’s next? We are a team of passionate engineers who are designing, prototyping, analyzing, and eventually launching the next new product category at Apple. Our goal is to ensure the highest quality product for our customers. As a Safety Product Designer on this team, you will use first principles and measurable outcomes to guide product architecture. Quantitative results will allow our team to set design specifications, de-risk novel features, and prove viability of creative solutions. Key Qualifications You operate by first principles and are motivated by improving human outcomes 4+ years of experience with applied biomechanics. Key experience includes prosthetics, helmets, crash, automotive safety, orthopedic implants or similar. Creative problem solver with experience in failure analysis, root cause investigation, and DOE creation This job can only be done from inside Apple's corporate headquarters. 2+ years of hands-on, detailed product design experience and have shipped a wearable device Proficiency in 3D CAD (any modeling package) Experience integrating dynamic and/or non-linear FEM into design Experience with structural optimization Deep knowledge of engineering materials and manufacturing processes Excellent communication habits; we value people who are inquisitive, who clearly state perspective once formed, and who are good humored. Detail orientated and capable of handling multiple assignments at once Experience with human physiology and response to impact stimuli Description The primary scope of work will be to design robust prototypes and product architectures and evaluate through physical tests, simulated events, and human studies. To complete these tests and to inform product design, you will collaborate with teams like Industrial Design, Human Factors, Human Engineering, Soft Goods, Design validation, Materials, and more. You will have a uniquely rewarding opportunity to craft future products that will delight and inspire millions of people every day. Education & Experience Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering required Master of Science preferred and/or PhD PhD/MS in Biomechanics / Biomedical Engineering is a bonus Role Number: 200428055

jobTitle: Sales Operations Data Scientist, Advertising Platforms
jobDescription: Summary At Apple, we work every day to create products that enrich people’s lives. Our Advertising Platforms group makes it possible for people around the world to easily access informative and imaginative content on their devices while helping publishers and developers promote and monetize their work. Our technology and services power advertising in Apple News and Search Ads in App Store. Our platforms are highly-performant, deployed at scale, and setting new standards for enabling effective advertising while protecting user privacy. Launched in 2016, Search Ads is an easy, efficient and fast-growing platform for app discovery. With over 65% of all app downloads resulting directly from a search in the App Store, Search Ads is quickly becoming the app promotion platform of choice for iOS developers. We are looking for a smart and passionate Data Scientist to support our growing advertising business. In this role, you will work within our Advertising Platforms Sales Operations team to support and empower the sales organization by building impactful analyses and insights. You’ll help us architect complex but practical insights, establish strategies/priorities based on empirical observations and measure success. Key Qualifications 5+ years of experience in data science, analytics, or consulting roles, preferably in the digital advertising industry, with a strong track record of solving complex analytical problems and positively influencing business outcomes Advanced technical skills in SQL, Python, and Tableau Experience in advanced quantitative analysis including regression, classification, clustering, and time-series analyses Experience to automate and scale analysies and dashboards Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with experience building stories and narratives out of data Excellent research, project management, and organizational skills Description A successful candidate will have deep experience in applied analytical methods, experience building reporting dashboards, and using those methods and tools to drive key business insights. The role requires both a broad knowledge of existing data science techiniques and strong business acumen. You’ll be working on projects where tools and methods are used to drive real-world business value, using creativity to invent and customize when necessary. - Drive the generation of insights and identify trends/key metrics from large, complex data in support of our global sales organization - Support the rollout of sales strategies by building foundational data sets and analyses, incorporating a focus on measuring outcomes and success - Partner cross-functionally within Advertising Platforms to ensure proper data quality, availability and governance - Build and enhance internal business intelligence, data visualization and reporting capabilities Education & Experience BS in data science, statistics, economics, computer science or other quantitative field. Advanced degree preferred. Additional Requirements Experience with advertising, measurement, and/or digital analytics Role Number: 200432552

Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. The people here at Apple don’t just craft products -- they build the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. Apple University provides wide-ranging and outstanding educational programs for Apple employees. Through our original curricula, we strive to cultivate deeper understanding, critical reflection, and engaged discussion about Apple’s culture, organization, and values, and about the social context and public culture in which Apple works. To advance these daring aims, Apple University crafts and delivers original classes, tools, workshops, and media. These offerings help encourage intellectual curiosity, sustain debate, and build thoughtful and informed leadership throughout the company. The University team includes faculty from academia, with deep expertise in select subject areas, as well as faculty who previously held leadership roles within Apple and were drawn to instruct. They work with the Production team, which includes the broad areas of expertise required to develop, produce, and deliver all of the offerings listed above. Designers within Apple University work side-by-side faculty, content producers, and the program team, to bring all of our materials to life. They use the power of design to clarify, connect, and surprise. Senior designers operate at multiple levels — crafting the structure and form of materials and getting into the details of the deliverable. They do this across a breadth of media, including websites, presentations, documents, videos, and apps. As part of the university, designers and creators who excel will find engagement in the ideas and thinking that underlie our work — they will obsess over how to convey it simply, beautifully, and in a way that engages others in reflection and discussion. Key Qualifications 8–10 years crafting and designing in a range of styles and media — static, dynamic, and interactive. You have taken briefs and come up with original and conceptual designs and styles. As a bonus, you have designed to help educate. Expertise in Adobe suite, Keynote, Sketch, Blender, FCP, Motion, and 3D design tools. Some understanding of HTML, CSS, and/or other interactive technologies. While this role is focused on graphics and animation, you may be asked to work on some UI and UX — so you’re extra qualified if you have experience with or curiosity about those areas. Experience designing inclusively — attending to accessibility, as well as the wide range of considerations that accompany work that's accessible for everyone. Description Beyond those qualifications, we are looking for a thoughtful, curious, and collaborative designer who can see themselves in the following: - You accept a blank canvas with little to no direction — just an idea. You brainstorm, prototype, and repeat over and over again. (But you also know how to do this against a deadline.) - You also adopt the simplification and refinement of someone else’s prototype. You can pick up others’ work and make it better. - You can enjoy huge projects and confined projects similarly. You like big scope, but won’t balk at crafting a great worksheet. - You will design or draw an image that will capture a phrase or a full essay — to seek to bring together the spirit of ideas. - You’re extremely generative on your own — and also highly collaborative. You’re passionate about your ideas, but also humble enough to let your ideas go or evolve. - You do not shy away from big or abstract concepts. You can get engaged in understanding and thinking about those ideas — being the “first student” who helps others understand and reflect. - You obsess over the details — like really obsess. You push pixels and debate for hours about them. - You listen to different perspectives/opinions and have to form a point of view about the right ones to absorb. - You can design for feeling as well as information, whether it be Keynote, a website, or a video. Role Number: 200433759

jobTitle: Simulation and Machine Learning Engineer, Ad Platforms
jobDescription: Summary At Apple, we work every single day to build products that enrich people’s lives! Our Advertising Platforms group makes it possible for people around the world to easily access informative and visionary content on their devices while helping publishers and developers promote and monetize their work. We are a team of passionate scientists and technologists, dedicated to helping publishers and developers find their audience, and changing the way advertising works with data. Our technology and services power advertising in Apple News and Search Ads in App Store. Our platforms are highly-performant, deployed at scale, and setting new standards for enabling effective advertising while protecting user privacy. We are looking for an exceptional hands-on data science / machine learning engineer who can thrive in a fast-paced environment. The Simulation team has two main roles. The first is to maintain and improve our simulation capability for other members of Ad Platforms to be able to run simulations to answer questions they have. The second is to propose, build, suggest, and analyze our advertising systems with offline experimentation and to develop new statistical techniques. A couple of examples of the kinds of things that we might work on: implementing a threshold counterfactual analysis in simulation to test the feasibility of the approach before committing to deploying it in production, and doing risk analyses of the business impact to our marketplace if a large advertiser left. The position also involves developing a keen understanding of the behavior of our Ad Platforms systems; detecting meaningful data patterns; assuring the integrity and breadth of the data; measuring user, campaign and app performance; and finally analyzing the results of large-scale experiments. Key Qualifications You can apply advanced statistical methods and work with large, complex data sets. You can actively participate in investigations into multiple streams of ads quality data, draw conclusions from data, and recommend actions. You have experience in some of the following domains: Algorithms, Artificial Intelligence, Database Systems, Data Mining, Distributed Systems, Machine Learning, Statistics, Game Theory, Auction Design, Control Theory or other experience with rigorous quantitative analyses. You have experience developing in Python or Java. You are familiar with databases, SQL, and scripting languages. You have a practical understanding of modern machine learning and/or statistics. You enjoy working closely with operational teams on deployment, monitoring, and management concerns. Description At Ad Platforms, we are constantly improving our algorithms to provide amazing user experiences and drive value for publishers and developers. You will find opportunities to improve our platform and build out data products that drive value for our advertisers. You will invent, design and implement new algorithms using machine learning and data science systems. You will have the opportunity to design and implement experimentation strategies to understand the impact of new models, work with cross functional teams to prototype new concepts, and deliver end-to-end systems in an agile setting. You will work with colleagues on a shared code base, sharing and contributing in a highly collaborative environment! Education & Experience - PhD in a quantitative field (or BS/MS with equivalent work experience) Additional Requirements Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Role Number: 200404867

Summary Do you love crafting sophisticated solutions to highly complex challenges? Do you intrinsically see the importance in every detail? You’ll ensure Apple products and services can seamlessly and efficiently handle the tasks that make them beloved by millions. The same passion for innovation that goes into our products also applies to our practices — strengthening our dedication to leave the world better than we found it. You should join us to help deliver the next amazing Apple product! Joining Apple as a SoC Embedded Software Engineer, you will craft and implement embedded software for System on a Chip (SoC) bring up and test. You will write software for Apple silicon in a bare metal environment and work closely with the Silicon Validation and Software Engineering teams to bring up new silicon and ensure the quality of every device when manufactured. Key Qualifications 2+ years of embedded software experience, including debugging and characterization. Exposure to SoC bring up. Expert embedded C programmer. Experience using laboratory equipment (e.g., logic analyzer, digital oscilloscope). Experience reading and working from device and board schematics. Description • Design and implementation of firmware for SoC bring up, validation, and test. • Enhancing and maintaining the development and debug environments, tools and methodologies. • Support of functional test environment for device characterization, failure analysis, and mass production. • Generating post-silicon directed diagnostic and stress test cases and debugging failure cases using multiple HW and low level SW platforms. • Leveraging and porting design verification and silicon validation tests to enable improved test coverage of IP in silicon test. • Developing software to confirm that the silicon behaves as architected under the various supported modes. • Developing targeted functional tests to screen failures identified during the product lifecycle. Education & Experience BSCS, BSEE, BSCE, or proven equivalent experience.… Role Number: 200241442

Summary Would you like to join Apple’s growing wireless silicon development team? Our wireless SOC organization is responsible for all aspects of wireless silicon development with a particular emphasis on highly energy efficient design and new technologies that transform the user experience at the product level, all of which is driven by a world-class vertically integrated engineering team spanning RF/Analog architecture and design, Systems/PHY/MAC architecture and design, VLSI/RTL design and integration, Emulation, Design Verification, Test and Validation, and FW/SW engineering. The SOC Verification Engineer will be responsible for pre-silicon RTL verification of block and top level SOC. With deep understanding of SOC architecture and meticulous attention to details, you will interact with all disciplines to develop reusable testbench and verification environment deploying the latest methodology with metric driven verification. Key Qualifications 1-3+ years of verification experience. Solid fundamentals in Verilog and System Verilog for verification. Basic knowledge of UVM methodology. Solid verification skills in problem solving and debugging. Experience with Constrained Random testing is a plus. Good understanding of overall verification flow. Knowledge of industry standard interfaces like 12C, UART, SPI. Understanding and usage of System Verilog Assertion (SVA) Programing experience in C Experience writing scripts in languages such as Perl or Python a plus. Should be great teammate with excellent communication skills and desire to take on diverse challenges. Description - Understand details of microarchitecture and build block / chip level testbench using best-in-class verification methodology. - Create verification plan from specification and in coordination with architects. - Generate directed and ingenuous constrained random tests. - Create/analyze coverage model and enhance testbench/test to increase coverage. - Build automated flows for block and chip level verification. - Debug failures, manage bug tracking, and close coverage. - Hold detailed verification reviews and set standard for coding quality. - Work closely with team members to improve methodology and flow. Education & Experience Typically requires MSEE Role Number: 200433474
