Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Do you love thinking analytically? Are you passionate about using your financial knowledge to navigate complex challenges? Just as our customers find value in Apple products, the Finance group finds value for both Apple and its shareholders. As part of this group, you’ll play an integral role in ensuring our day-to-day financial health. You and your team will support Apple’s growth, both top and bottom line, by applying the same level of innovation toward financial matters as we do toward our products and services. You’ll also collaborate with Apple teams across the world to develop more effective investment strategies and risk management. Finance is essential to upholding our global commitment to excellence, and it is directly responsible for shaping the company’s future. Join us, and you’ll have a significant role in continuing Apple’s legacy of efficiency and success. Key Qualifications 3+ years of finance experience in treasury, preferably with corporate experience Foreign exchange experience Working knowledge of risk management techniques and strategies Effective communication, presentation and social skills High level of integrity, initiative, motivation and curiosity Emphasis on consistently producing high quality results Strong analytical skills, problem solving and critical thinking Ability to work effectively on a dynamic team in a fast-paced environment Ability to deal with ambiguity Advanced knowledge of Excel, knowledge of Tableau and SQL are a plus Working knowledge of Bloomberg and/or Reuters, SAP Description Manage foreign currency risk for a dynamic, multi-program (cash flow hedging, balance sheet hedging, net investment hedging) FX hedge portfolio. Utilize conceptual and working knowledge of options and their application in a risk management context. Perform macro-economic research and analysis. Identify currency exposures and develop appropriate hedge strategies. Execute FX spot, forward and options transactions. Interact with FX banking partners. Analyze FX forecasts and results and optimize hedging costs, hedge ratios, and hedge structures. Perform extensive analysis of derivative hedging instruments and evaluate the impact on the portfolios and our performance. Work with the team to develop analytical tools to support portfolio management. Participate in quarter-end accounting close activities and ensure compliance with hedge accounting standards. Ensure maintenance of and compliance with an effective control environment including participation in Sarbanes-Oxley efforts. Work with cross-functional teams including Tax and Financial Planning & Analysis to support both broad corporate and Treasury specific initiatives. Lead/assist with ad hoc projects. Education & Experience MBA, CPA, CFA or other professional certification and/or FX industry experience a plus Role Number: 200420272

Summary The Apple Media Products Engineering team is one of the most exciting examples of Apple’s long-held passion for combining art and technology. These are the people who power the App Store, Apple TV, Apple Music, Apple Podcasts, and Apple Books. And they do it on a massive scale, meeting Apple’s high expectations with high performance to deliver a huge variety of entertainment in over 35 languages to more than 150 countries. These engineers build secure, end-to-end solutions. They develop the custom software used to process all the creative work, the tools that providers use to deliver that media, all the server-side systems, and the APIs for many Apple services. Thanks to Apple’s unique integration of hardware, software, and services, engineers here partner to get behind a single unified vision. That vision always includes a deep commitment to strengthening Apple’s privacy policy, one of Apple’s core values. Although services are a bigger part of Apple’s business than ever before, these teams remain small, nimble, and cross-functional, offering greater exposure to the array of opportunities here. Apple is seeking a highly experienced User Interface Engineer to join our Apple Media Products team. Key Qualifications At least 5 years of experience building complex, large scale applications in using modern web technologies, including HTML/CSS/JavaScript or TypeScript (preferred). Demonstrated proficiency in at least one JavaScript framework like React, Vue.js, Angular.js or equivalent Demonstrated proficiency in modern CSS development using SASS Deep knowledge of Node.js, NPM, Webpack, Babel or other toolchains Deep knowledge of testing frameworks like Jest, Cypress, QUnit, etc. as well as testing best practices General knowledge of networking protocols HTTP/1 & HTTP/2 (GET, POST), cookies and other HTTP headers General knowledge of web development best practices around accessibility, performance and production monitoring Strong interpersonal and written communication skills [Optional] Some experience with iOS application development (Objective-C/Swift) Description As a UI Engineer you will be responsible for building the next generation of user experiences for our industry leading Music Subscription service and the iTunes Store platform. We need a highly motivated and skillful engineer to work with HTML, JavaScript, and CSS and related tooling, frameworks, and libraries. Attention to detail and a dedication to deliver a high-quality, stable delivery is essential. To be successful you are self-motivated; driven to achieve and exceed commitments. You also need to exude strong collaboration skills, including the ability to mentor and be mentored. Possess a strong passion to work in a growing, energizing environment of innovation. If you want to be part of this amazing team, this position is for you. Education & Experience BS in Computer Science or related discipline or equivalent experience. Pay & Benefits At Apple, your base pay is one part of your total compensation package. This role pays between $131,000 and $242,000, and your actual base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Apple employees also have the opportunity to own shares of Apple stock, because all Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, as well as a discount when purchasing Apple stock if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive other benefits: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits. Note: Apple benefits programs are subject to eligibility requirements. Role Number: 200332870

Summary Apple Arcade and Game Center are at the core of Apple’s growing games business. We aim to both provide an excellent experience for our existing game developers and to attract a broader range of game developers to Apple platforms. As a senior game developer experience engineer on the Game Center Frameworks team, you will help shape the next generation of games across the Apple ecosystem. Your work will grow the Apple Arcade portfolio and enable developers to offer great gaming experiences. Our team strives to build a diverse, inclusive team and healthy, balanced work environment. We believe that every engineer brings unique skills and perspective. Come work with us and translate your talent into great experiences for a global audience of customers and other developers! Key Qualifications Experience with C/C++ API development. Proficiency in or capacity for a wide range of game engines and programming environments. Passion for games and the developers who create them. Description The Game Center Frameworks team delivers the GameKit framework for all Apple platforms. Every Apple Arcade game, as well as many other games in the App Store, integrate with Game Center for a variety of services including identity, achievements, leaderboards, friends, matchmaking, multiplayer networking, and more. We also partner with teams across Apple to bring core functionality like graphics, audio, controller input, haptic feedback, and system integrations to popular game engines, such as Unity. As a senior game developer experience engineer on the Game Center Frameworks team, your responsibilities will include: * Maintaining Apple’s open source Unity plugin. * Collaborating with teams across Apple to improve their APIs for game developers. * Expanding access to Apple APIs to new game engines and programming environments. * Supporting third-party game developers to build the best possible games. * Represent a voice of game developers within the Game Center team. * Designing and implementing new Game Center Framework functionality. Education & Experience BSCs or equivalent Additional Requirements Desired experience: Unity Engine plugin development C# and Microsoft Common Language Runtime (or Mono) PRIOR EXPERIENCES THAT ARE A PLUS FOR THIS ROLE: Swift, Objective-C, or other Apple platform toolkits Unreal Engine, especially plugin development Client/server networking applications Role Number: 200439243

jobTitle: US Business Operations - Channel Sales Operations Analyst
jobDescription: Summary Imagine what you could do here. The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. Are you a strategic problem solver who excels at tactical execution? Do you love to tackle problems and create a structured process out of the complex? As part of our US Business Operations team, you will be responsible for reimagining the customer experience of our channel partner community and executing on that vision. Apple’s reseller community is an integral part of delivering the best products, services, and experience to our customers, and you will be part of the team that makes it all possible. Key Qualifications 5+ years of experience working with a channel sales organization, preferably with operational responsibilities including channel incentive programs and reseller agreements. Resourceful, creative and detail-oriented with exceptional communication and organizational skills. Ability to think strategically and also execute flawlessly under tight timelines. Prior experience in driving process improvement projects, from definition through implementation. Record of effectively partnering with cross-functional teams such as legal, contracts, and finance. Ability to work individually with little supervision as well as with a team of diverse views and interests. Passion for Apple technology and knowledge of Apple products and solutions Some project management and/or business process reengineering experience a plus. Description We work closely with the US sales teams as functional leaders in key channel sales programs and processes. We support a rapidly growing business; as you execute on today’s activities, you will also reimagine what’s possible and find innovative new ways to build scale and ensure our capabilities elevate at the same rate as the businesses we support. In this role, you will: Manage the partner experience including reseller authorizations, partner onboarding, and partner communications Partner with the State and Local Government sales team on establishing an effective reseller structure Measure and process monthly and quarterly channel incentive payments Capture as-is processes and propose and implement efficient, automated processes Establish criteria for reseller capabilities to ensure our channel is well-positioned to provide customers with the products and services that meet our customers’ needs Liaise with legal, contracts, and finance on reseller agreements Education & Experience Bachelor’s degree or 5+ years successfully supporting channel sales organizations Additional Requirements Role can be based in Cupertino, Austin, Washington, DC, or Miami Role Number: 200429005

Summary The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Help us leave the world better than we found it. Apple’s US Sales organization generates the revenue needed to fuel our ongoing development of products and services. Apple is seeking a Sales Operations Lead to support the U.S. Consumer Sales team. This person will optimize productivity and maximize the output of this multi-billion dollar business by facilitating sales planning, owning business performance measurement, aiding in supply/allocation decisions, managing quota, and leading and measuring new product introductions (NPI) and key sales programs. Successful candidates will be strong and practical problem-solvers with experience managing a sales operations/programs driven organization. You will work effectively and efficiently across multiple functional areas. As the Consumer Sales Operations lead, you will work directly with Sales leadership, Finance, Legal, Operations, as well as other key stakeholders. A successful candidate must have spent time directly interacting with and supporting the success of a large sales organization. Key Qualifications Have the functional expertise in the use of data and insights to provide business decision support for sales performance tracking and supply/allocation decisions. Have experience with the systems and tools that support large Sales organizations. Create and assess coverage models and account assignments. Lead without direct accountability - orchestrating across teams, yours and others, to build and manage complex projects to drive business strategies and influence all levels of leadership. Run effective sales processes and lead quarterly business reviews. Strive for excellence in everything you do. Have a "donʼt give up" attitude, and finish, especially in the face of resistance or setbacks. Seize every opportunity and empower others to reach their goals along the way. Ensure the team is effectively using the tools, business metrics, and reviews to meet and exceed these commitments. See around corners and look beyond just today. Have an understanding of the competitive landscape, industry trends, and external pressures. See the world through the eyes of the customer. Unlock the potential of every relationship. You do this by getting to know people, soliciting input and feedback from a wide variety of experts at Apple. Have the ability to connect with and influence the right people, at all levels and functions in the company. Ability to manage difficult conversations and own the hard calls. Being responsible for the success of a project even when you don’t oversee all the pieces. Achieve success by relying on your own expertise, trusting in others to deliver on theirs, and through deep collaboration. Keep confidences and work selflessly to always do what’s best for Apple. Strong Excel and presentation-building (e.g. Keynote) skills required. Tableau Desktop experience a plus. Description Design, build, facilitate and own the core sales processes needed to run the business — this includes quota setting, pipeline management, business reviews, supply allocation decisions, NPI management, and key program tracking. Own consumer business performance analysis - identifying variances, defining causes, specifying potential actions and their impact. Show impact of market and competitive dynamics on business performance over various time periods. Work with Sales leadership to track long-term, annual, and quarterly sales priorities. Support strategic business planning and cadences to enable future revenue growth. Make the right decisions for Apple through deconstructing complex issues into actionable ideas; have the capacity to zero in on what is most impactful, and a willingness to say no to good ideas so that we can do something great. This includes leading changing priorities and supporting urgent customer needs. Education & Experience 5-8 years of experience leading sales planning and operations; or similar experience in finance or analytics functions, leading across diverse teams that balanced between delivering on short-term revenue goals and seeing around corners to enable future growth.  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education. Role Number: 200426743

Summary The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries! It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it! Apple’s Sales organization generates the revenue needed to fuel our ongoing development of products and services. This in turn, enriches the lives of hundreds of millions of people around the world. Our sales team, is in many ways, the face of Apple to our largest customers. Key Qualifications Apple and the industry You understand there are many moving parts in an organization. Navigating the interdependencies within Apple is needed for success. Understanding how business financials work, and strategies for sustaining profitable growth, are key to staying ahead of the competition. Analyze the market and think beyond the short-term. Apple doesn’t cut corners, in products or in business. Bring the highest level of integrity, honesty, and accountability in all that you do, every single day. As a trusted advisor who does what you say you’ll do – and always does what’s best for Apple. Customer, partner and team relationships See the world through the eyes of the customer by deeply understanding their business needs, challenges, and concerns. You obsess over how they experience our products and services. You not only meet our customers’ expectations, but you exceed them. Customer and partner needs can often be unique – but, you’re quick on your feet and connect and influence the right people both inside and outside of Apple. As a go to person with leadership, you are trusted and comfortable in tough situations. Settle disputes, negotiations and own the hard calls with minimal noise. You step up to conflicts and see them as opportunities to shine. Strategy, solutions and results Apple and third party solutions solve sophisticated business problems in simple and innovative ways. Create competitive and breakthrough strategies that truly shape the future. You do this by asking why and why not, both stripping out what is not crucial and identifying what is. By doing so, you are able to see what’s ahead and identify trends that will be critical for growth. Do you think clearly? You simplify sophisticated problems and distill big decisions down to their core. It’s rarely easy. Sometimes decisions require you to make tough calls, even after considerable energy has been invested - but you own it. You stand by your deep analysis, wisdom and experience to make quality and timely decisions. Description The US Enterprise Field Marketing team is looking for a best-in-class enterprise field marketing professional to play a strategic role in supporting Apple’s Enterprise focused on driving growth for our Mac go-to-market. Delivering, and jointly marketing Apple Mac solutions and services to our enterprise customers across all commercial segments and all routes to market. You will build and drive Apple’s field marketing strategy and execution, as well as capture requirements fo content, campaigns and sales tools, and also define how best to market to these customers, and through our partners that supports our sales goals and priorities. In this critical role you will own the development, execution and measurement of engagement, demand generation, pipeline creation and revenue-generating marketing programs. You will also work closely and collaborate with our sales teams, our channel partners, training and enablement, programs, field marketing, and extended marketing teams. Part of this role will also be to drive all new product introductions (NPI) and launches within our enterprise route to market (Channel Resellers, Carrier B2B, Distribution, US Major Accounts). This will be a coordination effort across multiple stakeholders within Apple as well as how our launches are executed with our reseller partners as well. The coordination and collaboration will need to be aligned across our business that will include sales, operations, product and marketing teams, enablement and training, digital, partners and reseller teams, which is aligned with our consumer teams that will continue to build our momentum in the market with new innovative products that creates excitement in the market as we continue to build efficiency from an operational perspective. Business at Apple is big. We design innovative marketing initiatives and sales programs for our largest customers, resellers, and partners – ones that scale and evolve. We collaborate with our Apple teammates from all areas of the company to get it done. Build and implement a variety of Marketing Programs to drive awareness of Apple's value proposition for our enterprise and B2B customers - with a focus on awareness, demand/lead generation programs, communications, digital marketing and events. And once a program is launched, we ‘ll continue to improve it. We work together with our strategic partners and resellers to identify joint demand generation opportunities, align sales priorities and foster customer engagement and relationships. We work closely with our Major Account teams (fortune 1000) to build campaigns that will drive demand and new leads/opportunities for Apple products and services. We curate and communicate enterprise marketing content and collateral for our sales team, resellers and partners. We also build and communicate marketing content and collateral working closely with our channel partners to develop and execute marketing plans and campaigns to amplify our message. Education & Experience Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience Additional Requirements 5-10 years of enterprise or channel field marketing experience Experience leading Enterprise Marketing initiatives, or similar experience having managed campaigns or programs for enterprise B2B customers, that balanced delivering on short-term goals, while crafting balanced value for customer, that also scale through our resellers and partners. Role Number: 200400612

Discover even more benefits of doing what you love. Apple’s most important resource, our soul, is our people. No matter where you work at Apple, you can take advantage of our health and wellness resources and time-away programs. You’ll discover many more benefits of working at Apple, such as programs that match your charitable contributions, reimburse you for continuing your education, and give you special employee pricing on Apple products. Note: Apple benefits programs vary by country and are subject to eligibility requirements. jobTitle: US Merchandising & NPI Operations Program Manager
jobDescription: Summary The people here at Apple don’t just build products — they build the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that encourages the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it! Apple’s Sales organization generates the revenue needed to fuel our ongoing development of products and services. This, in turn, enriches the lives of hundreds of millions of people around the world. We are, in many ways, the face of Apple to our largest customers! The US Channel Store Operations team is looking for a US Merchandising and NPI Operations Program Manager dedicated to ensuring that the physical elements of the Customer Experience meet the standards and expectations of Apple. This role is part of a team that owns all aspects of the physical experience: deploying Apple fixtures and shop-in-shops in our partners doors; working with our partners on their fixtures to ensure their merchandising meets Apple standards; re-merchandising all locations with Apple products and graphics; launching new products; and working with third party vendors to visit and assess the adherence by our partners to Apple standards. Key Qualifications A minimum of 5 years work experience in a merchandising and/or retail operations focused role Excel proficiency required. Tableau a plus Proven success in process design and implementation Excellent verbal and written communication Business planning and exceptional reporting skills Strong organizational skills including ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously A team player with a hands-on, positive attitude; able to work effectively with other teams, influence without authority, and bring others on the journey. A driver who is self motivated and operates with a great sense of urgency, even under limited direction Ability to drive progress and be comfortable working in an unstructured environment A keen eye for detail Passion for the customer and team experience Ability to troubleshoot problems quickly and think “outside the box” to solve problems Ability to prioritize deliverables to balance speed and accuracy Description You will partner with US and worldwide Sales, Sales Operations, Marcom, and Third Party Vendors to refresh fixture programs at launch and develop action plans to redress issues. The insights you provide will help the team refine processes designed to track, triage and solve maintenance and repair issues and to manage non-inventory supplies. You will confirm and validate store lists to improve forecasts of non-inventory and graphic elements. You will be the expert who can present the issues to internal and external audiences to drive improvement. - Establish and refine merchandising program policies and processes for internal and external partners - Manage budget to deliver on business priorities annually and adjust quarterly - Maintain close contact with Field and internal stakeholders (solicit feedback, validate requirements, obtain approvals, achieve consensus on design) - Manage vendor relationships and budgets. Facilitate quarterly business review meetings - Deliver analytics and reporting on merchandising program goals, objectives and efficiencies Education & Experience BA or BS degree or equivalent experience Role Number: 200397826

jobTitle: US State & Local Government Account Executive
jobDescription: Summary Imagine what you could do here. The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. Apple’s US Government Sales organization generates the revenue needed to fuel our ongoing development of products and services. This, in turn, enriches the lives of hundreds of millions of people around the world. Our sales team is, in many ways, the face of Apple to our largest customers. At the end of the day, we are here to help businesses and governments transform the way people work — while growing top-line revenue for Apple. To realize this goal, we gain deep understanding of the businesses we manage — at all levels from tactical to strategic. We create a vision that can inspire customers to transform using Apple products. We collaborate closely with internal and external partners to create plans for solutions and new use cases, and then we help drive adoption of the solution. This is a home-based position that can be located in the Chicago metropolitan area. Key Qualifications 7+ years consultative selling experience in business transformation solutions to US State & Local government agencies Ability to align an organization's priorities, initiatives, and transformational goals to broadly engage customer executives — at the department and IT levels Excellent collaboration and interpersonal skills Strong written and verbal communication skills, along with the ability to effectively communicate how our partners, along with Apple, deliver the best solutions to our customers. Description As a US State & Local Government Account Executive, you will: - Drive the adoption of the Apple ecosystem in your territory with our industry partners. - Leverage your background working with State & Local customers in your assigned territory to understand their unique requirements and plans for innovation. - Work collaboratively across Apple, with our customers, partners, and solutions providers to become the trusted advisor on Apple hardware, software and services solutions. - Develop and execute account plans aligned to our customers’ strategies by partnering cross-functionally with Inside Sales, Systems Engineers, resellers, carriers and other strategic partners. - Build demand generation activities, identify new opportunities, accurately forecast, and coordinate fulfillment logistics. Education & Experience Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience Role Number: 200430886

Summary Apple is working with advanced technologies to build ground-breaking new products. We are seeking a candidate that has a demonstrated history bringing new ideas to life as interactive, high-fidelity prototypes in a new medium. The candidate with be a critical contributor on an interdisciplinary team of highly-specialized researchers, engineers, and creatives. Creativity is at the heart of this position. We are excited about applicants with backgrounds as creative technologists, UX or product design prototypers, technical artists, or application developers. This role operates in concert with research scientists to help drive development of future-facing products. As a key member of this team, you will have a unique and impactful opportunity to prototype ideas for future products. Key Qualifications Industry experience building immersive 3D applications, prototypes, and simulations in a variety of game engines (Unity, Unreal, Godot, etc) and Hardware Five or more years writing efficient and reusable code in an application programming language (Swift, C#, C++, etc). One or more years with a systems programming language (C, C++, Objective-C, Rust, etc). Experience working with 3D content creation tools such as Houdini, Maya, Blender, etc. Experience with rapid prototyping, with a good intuition and communication in making time vs. complexity tradeoffs Experience with working with Creatives and executing on Design for prototypes You’re a self-starter with a passion and curiosity for building with new technologies and making things better for people 2+ years of experience developing UI and interactive experiences for shipped products Software engineering skills beyond coding: source control, unit testing, debugging, documentation, continuous integration, and build systems. Self-directed with the ability to collaborate across the organization to gather consensus on ideas, priorities, deliverables, and deadlines Fluent in trends & technologies across the spatial computing space. AR/VR Experience is a plus. (Preferred) Experience collecting multimodal sensor data or instrumenting prototypes for analysis. (Preferred) Knowledge of qualitative & quantitative techniques in user research (e.g. subjective assessments and objective statistical measures). Description In this role, you will build and prototype new experiences using evolving technologies. Your work will help shape our future products. We have a real passion for new technologies and product development, and you will work closely with other Apple designers, artists, engineers, and researchers to craft transformative, empowering experiences for Apple audiences. You should be able to balance customer needs with technical constraints to help translate and realize the team’s ideas. You will join projects at varying stages of production, ranging from research and concept, to rapid prototyping, to polishing and optimizing UI/interactions for shipping, working closely with partners to ensure a high-quality product. The role requires attention to detail, curiosity, adaptability, and thoughtfulness as you produce beautiful interactive concepts, while navigating through unusual technical challenges. Education & Experience BS or MS in Computer Science, Interaction Design, Game Design, or equivalent experience Additional Requirements Familiarity with SwiftUI and/or iOS development Knowledge of MacOS and iOS design principles Proficient in iterative UI/UX design, including sketches, wireframes, concept, and feature development in close collaboration with cross-functional stakeholders Role Number: 200408969

Summary The Technology Development Group (TDG) is looking for UX Researcher to help us shape and craft the next generation of interactive applications for our platform. This team is working with some of Apple's most advanced technologies including augmented reality (AR), virtual reality (VR), machine learning (ML) and computer vision (CV). As a member of our organization, you will assist us in crafting future products that will delight, inspire and empower millions of people. Summary We are the Video Engineering Image Quality (VEIQ) team responsible for video quality on iPhone, iPad, and Mac products! Summary Apple’s growing technology development is looking for a live events Videographer with a passion for anything sports or live entertainment related. The Videographer will be working with cutting edge camera & audio systems to capture great moments in sports, music and humanity. From fast paced action on the sidelines of a sports arena, to a front row seat of a history making event, the Videographer - Live Events will capture great moments for a global and diverse audience. A “normal day at the office” may include working at high energy, multi-day live sports event, stadium or arena, then immediately flying to a remote, out of the way location to capture a live humanities piece with only the most basic capture gear in a backpack. Each event is treated as a “zero downtime”, “failure-is-not-an-option” high stakes capture where minutes equal dollars and there’s only one chance to capture amazing content. If this sounds familiar and exciting, this could be the opportunity you’ve been working towards. Key Qualifications 5+ years experience working as a camera operator or videographer in live broadcast, news or ENG/EPK/BTS productions. Hands-on experience working with high-end professional camera technologies (Sony, Panasonic, ARRI, Canon, RED, etc). Comfort with troubleshooting complex camera, audio and rigging issues in high stakes production environments. Experience working with and navigating the complexities of venue access, security, and operations staff at large sports and event venues. Experience working directly with field producers, directors, tech managers, etc. Able to adapt to sudden and frequent changes in camera placement choice. Proven track record of being able to anticipate where action/activity will unfold and optimal camera placement for ideal capture. Ability to trouble shoot camera issues in high tension, time sensitive “on-air” moments. Able to lift 50 lbs to chest height while standing. Experience working in international, highly metropolitan, and underdeveloped locations as key camera. (This role requires 50%+ travel both domestically & internationally. It will be physically demanding at all times.) Description The Videographer will join a team of technology and production stakeholders working on a wide variety of projects at Apple. The Videographer will draw upon their past professional broadcast experience in live sports & music events or remote news to innovate story telling. With unprecedented access to event locations, capture technology and production staff, the Videographer will collaborate inclusively with the entire team from start to finish. Additional duties will include aspects of scouting, equipment prep, writing short technology performance feedback notes to the R&D teams and assisting in post event content quality assessments to help improve future shoots. Additional Requirements - Prior experience working with non-standard types of photography technology such as underwater, aerial, extreme conditions, and virtual production. - Comfortable and able to work in front of large crowds and by themselves. - Experience with remote “Robo” or remote camera head setup and operations. - Experience shooting in crowded areas with MoVi & FreeFly type camera systems. - Experience with camera rigging (Stills cameras, robo cams, car mounts, etc.) - Familiarity with typical video and audio recording formats commonly found in the cinematic or live broadcast industry. (RAW, ProRes, EXR, BWF, etc.) - Familiar with the usage or operation of production equipment typically found in cinematic or live broadcast environments. - Working knowledge of media production tools such as Adobe Premiere, Movie Magic, StudioBinder, Resolve, etc. - Must be available to work weekends, long hours or varying shifts when necessary to meet deadlines, 24/7, in all kinds of possible weather conditions. - Must be comfortable traveling with equipment cases on commercial air carriers. - Experience using organizational communication tools. (Google Docs, Keynote, PowerPoint, Omnigraffle, Vizio, Word, Pages, etc.) - Extensive work with domestic and international rental equipment and shipping service providers. (PRG, Panavision, Otto Nemenz, NEP/Bexel, ARRI Rental, FedEx Custom Critical, FilmLogics, SOS, PacAir, Delta, etc.) Role Number: 200391044

Summary The Vision Group is looking for a hardworking vision scientist to support the development of ground breaking imaging and display solutions and technologies for future Apple products. This position is passionate about the development, prototyping, and flawless execution of technologies to enable the best front-of-screen user experience of Apple products including iPhone, iPad, Watch, Mac and more. The team features a highly collaborative and hands- on environment that cultivates scientific and engineering perfection, creativity, and innovation in the interdisciplinary areas of vision science, image processing, color science, neuroscience, and optics. Key Qualifications Deep and broad knowledge of human vision Strong background in mathematical/computational modeling of vision Experience in design, conduct, and analysis of human perception experiments Knowledge of linear systems theory, Fourier analysis, and digital filtering Proficiency in Mathematica, MATLAB or similar simulation and modeling tools Basic understanding of digital imaging and display software and hardware Strong analytical & critical thinking and problem-solving skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English Description Apply vision science to design and evaluation of advanced displays, technologies and interfaces Develop models of early vision to support design of quality metrics Develop advanced display quality metrics to enable optimal product design Review archival vision science data to answer fundamental image quality questions Design and conduct efficient, robust user studies of human vision and image quality Guide feature and spec definition for future products based on image quality metrics Develop new products, features, and technologies based on vision science Education & Experience Ph.D. in Vision Science, Psychology, Imaging, Color, Computer Science, Optometry or Optics Additional Requirements These would be desirable, but are not a requirement: Understanding of human visual optics and their relation to visual experience Engineering background in digital image processing, color processing Familiarity with optometric methods, procedures and practice Experience with Psychophysics Toolbox, PsychoPy, QUEST+, or similar tools Experience with eye-tracking technology Experience in developing apps for iOS Role Number: 200204012

Summary We live in a mobile and device driven world where knowledge of the physical world around us is needed. We rely on this knowledge to get around, to learn about our environment and to enable spectacular new features for custom applications. Apple is meeting those needs as robustly and as creatively as possible and is interested in people who want to help meet that commitment. The success we are striving will be the result of very skilled people working in an environment which cultivates creativity, partnership, and thinking of old problems in new ways. If that sounds like the kind of environment that you find intriguing, then let's talk. These elements come together to make Apple an amazing environment for motivated people to do the greatest work of their lives. You will become part of a team that sets the standard in fostering excellence, creativity and innovation. Will you help us design the next generation of revolutionary Apple products? The Apple Watch Touch team is looking for a talented mechanical engineer to influence new designs as well as own and drive validation for new products and sensing technologies. You will work within a cross-functional team of experts whose shared goal is to ship products that surprise and delight our customers and break new ground in technology. Millions of customers will interact with the hardware you invent, develop and validate. Key Qualifications At least 4+ years of experience in a mechanical design, failure analysis, or validation role. Ability to inform design intent (requirements) and define path-to-validation. Ability to leverage various analysis techniques (tolerance analysis, FEA, CT, X-ray, FIB/SEM/EDX, Monte Carlo, design-of-experiments, etc.) to inform root cause. Ability to collaborate with a diverse cross-functional team and external vendors to achieve project goals. Excellent written, verbal, and visual communication skills are required. Familiarity with building 3D CAD and drafting 2D technical drawings is required. Strong technical curiosity and desire to learn is required. Proficiency in statistical analysis in MATLAB or JMP is preferred, but not required. Familiarity with sensor technology, analog/digital signals, flex circuits, IC packaging is preferred, but not required Description You will work on the mechanical design, integration and validation of the next generation of Apple Watch touch sensors. You would work and learn alongside a talented group from many engineering fields including electrical engineering, thin-films, quality, process, reliability, and more. As your expertise grows within the role, you will inform hardware design that will shape and create new customer experiences. As one of the mechanical experts of touch technology, you will be responsible your piece of the project: - Identifying/brainstorming design solutions, grading risk, and informing final design. - Leading a cross-functional team through failure analysis to identify root-cause and inform corrective actions. - Coordinating and managing the path-to-closure on complex, multi-faceted issues. - Applying rigorous and thoughtful experimental design to reduce design risk/uncertainty as quickly as possible. - Running tolerance studies to ensure designs are feasible over manufacturing tolerances. - Communicating to Apple’s engineering leadership in concise, comprehensive technical depth. In the prototyping and validation phases, you will support external manufacturing vendors with process development and root cause analysis for issues found during testing. Support for our vendors includes international travel between 15% and 25%. At the end of the extraordinary team effort, your work will be in the hands of millions of people making a visible difference in their daily lives. Education & Experience BSME required; MSME, PhD preferred (or equivalent) Role Number: 200398871

We partner with technical writers, engineering partners, and marketing stakeholders to establish goals for each new project. The ability to influence without directly managing teams and producing and sharing detailed project plans is critical. Summary We believe the future is powered by Wireless! The mission of the Wireless Power Technology team - Create the world’s best Wireless Charging user- experience by inventing state-of-the-art technologies. We develop effortless and safe Wireless Charging designs that are central to Apple’s products - the iPhone, Apple Watch, and AirPods! New challenges arise every day that require the sharp problem-solving skills of individuals. Are you in for the challenges? We are looking for a senior system integration engineer that leads the integration of the inductive technology into products in the partnership with multiple discipline teams including but not limited to architecture, FW, system EE, silicon, noise and vibration, safety, thermal, reliability, operations , regulatory teams and more. Key Qualifications 1+ years of hands-on experience and proven track record in system definition, integration, prototyping and validation. New grad considered for the role. Solid understanding of Agile / Scrum delivery models Prior experience in SDLC project management and analysis including scoping / timeline management, documenting use cases, process flows/swim lane diagrams, requirements, user acceptance testing, change management, etc. Working knowledge of process documentation and project management software Experience working with large-scale, complex datasets and using Salesforce data tools; Ability to design and implement dashboards in Einstein Analytics and Tableau CRM required Strong communication and presentation skills with the ability to quickly establish trust, credibility, and influence across a variety of cross-functional and multi-directional partners. Experience collaborating on global projects with a geographically dispersed team in a highly-matrixed, fast-paced environment. Description In this role, you will: - Understand the strategy and the changing needs of the business via workshop facilitation and roadmap development for future state. This will involve working with global management teams and colleagues across geographies. - Focus on recommending process innovation and efficiencies through current state process analysis, user experience, observations, industry trends, standard methodologies (Design Thinking, Agile), leading-edge technology and process improvement ideas to challenge the status quo and deliver extraordinary customer-focused solutions. - Be the inspiring leader in developing solutions as well as leading the project execution. It is important that you can think strategically, connecting the dots in the bigger picture, as well as being comfortable in the details of the deliverables. - Propose solutions beyond what has been requested by our business partners. You will work on opportunities to build for scale by designing holistically, with a focus on flexibility and maintainability. - Partner with leadership teams to craft business cases and budget for changes/projects. - Set up success criteria for your initiatives that are clearly measurable and achievable through the scope of deliverables, then ongoing tracking against these success criteria. - Adopt a standardized development lifecycle methodology for all projects including mobilization to scoping, requirements, use case documentation, design, business readiness, testing and implementation. - Support key business processes promoting application, data integrity, governance, and compliance. - Manage the Salesforce application and be the expert to define, design and configure enhancements to Salesforce platform that provide significant ROI by bridging the gap between out-of-the-box Salesforce functionalities and business processes. - Design and implement reports, dashboards, and alerts that support the business processes and deliver business insight. - Manage User Acceptance Testing with end users, including writing scripts and securing user acceptance sign offs. - Prepare the business for the change and adoption: Ensuring that from the very start of the project, there is a change management plan in place. By this time, we are live and the business is ready and excited to take on the adjustments to people, process, and technology. - Actively participate in ongoing discussions and engagements with Salesforce regarding Salesforce Sales Cloud, Consumer Goods Cloud, Partner Communities, and Einstein Analytics / Tableau CRM. Education & Experience - Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience required. - Master's Degree preferred. Additional Requirements - Salesforce Administrator Certification (required) - Agile SCRUM Master Certification (preferred) - Salesforce Sales Cloud Consultant Certification (preferred) - Salesforce Marketing Cloud Consultant (preferred) Role Number: 200389635

Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. The WW Retail Fulfillment Operations (RFO) team is seeking an Operations Excellence Program Manager to support our volume order fulfillment and promotions teams. This role partners with a multitude of internal teams building strategic process improvements, ensuring flawless execution of volume orders, and supporting promotional execution activities globally. The ideal candidate will be partnering closely with teams across Operations, Sales Planning, Supply/Demand Management, Business Process and Re-engineering, Retail Store Operations, Retail, Logistics, and IT. The WWRFO Operations Excellence Program Manager is a highly motivated individual with a passion for process improvement, organized, diligent, and highly capable of building sustainable processes across our volume order business and promotions space. Key Qualifications Solid understanding of advanced supply chain practices, strong analytical capabilities, leadership skills, and business savvy. Supply/Demand Planning, S&OP, online fulfillment, and store operations experience. Various experiences in different project management methodologies. An ability to visualize key concepts, timelines, and milestones into executive ready presentations. Ability to collaborate closely between teams with competing priorities to align to the most urgent and critical needs for leadership decisions. An individual who is self-motivated and operates with a great sense of urgency with a keen eye for detail. Background in Customer Experience (CX) and various Customer Journey methods. Ability to build sustainable management systems supporting volume orders, promotions, and fulfillment management from order placement through returns across online and stores. Description As a member of the WWRFO Operations Excellence team you will be responsible for providing recommendations based on analytical insights using reporting, managing end-to-end execution, and delivering innovative process improvements. -Liaise with WW and regional teams to identify deliverables, build execution plans, and process improvements. -Keep business partners informed of changing/existing plans and call out needed decisions. -Assess current business processes for improvement opportunities while redefining broad concepts and business strategies into structured projects leading design and implementation. -Establish a consistent communications platform to share and maintain business information with internal teams. -Build sustainable post-launch analysis for each change implementation and promotional launch to capture learnings for continuous process improvement. Education & Experience -Minimum 5 years of experience with increasing levels of responsibility. -BA/BS or equivalent experience required. Additional Requirements Program Management, Project Management, Operations, Supply Chain, Retail (stores and eCommerce). Candidates with experience in system and tool launches, process design and implementation, fulfillment, logistics, and new product introductions will be well regarded. Role Number: 200418056
